48 static const std::regex regex_special_chars{R"([-[\]{}()*+?.,\^$|#\s])"};
49 
50 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_string(const String& node) {
51  if (!codegen) {
52  return;
53  }
54  std::string name = node.eval();
55  if (enable_variable_name_lookup) {
56  name = get_variable_name(name);
57  }
58  printer->add_text(name);
59 }

62 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_integer(const Integer& node) {
63  if (!codegen) {
64  return;
65  }
66  const auto& value = node.get_value();
67  printer->add_text(std::to_string(value));
68 }

75  printer->add_text(format_float_string(node.get_value()));

113 /**
114  * \todo : Validate how @ is being handled in neuron implementation
115  */
116 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_var_name(const VarName& node) {
117  if (!codegen) {
118  return;
119  }
120  const auto& name = node.get_name();
121  const auto& at_index = node.get_at();
122  const auto& index = node.get_index();
123  name->accept(*this);
124  if (at_index) {
125  printer->add_text("@");
126  at_index->accept(*this);
127  }
128  if (index) {
129  printer->add_text("[");
130  printer->add_text("static_cast<int>(");
131  index->accept(*this);
132  printer->add_text(")");
133  printer->add_text("]");
134  }
135 }
136 
137 
138 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_indexed_name(const IndexedName& node) {
139  if (!codegen) {
140  return;
141  }
142  node.get_name()->accept(*this);
143  printer->add_text("[");
144  printer->add_text("static_cast<int>(");
145  node.get_length()->accept(*this);
146  printer->add_text(")");
147  printer->add_text("]");
148 }

151 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_local_list_statement(const LocalListStatement& node) {
152  if (!codegen) {
153  return;
154  }
155  printer->add_text(local_var_type(), ' ');
156  print_vector_elements(node.get_variables(), ", ");
157 }

160 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_if_statement(const IfStatement& node) {
161  if (!codegen) {
162  return;
163  }
164  printer->add_text("if (");
165  node.get_condition()->accept(*this);
166  printer->add_text(") ");
167  node.get_statement_block()->accept(*this);
168  print_vector_elements(node.get_elseifs(), "");
169  const auto& elses = node.get_elses();
170  if (elses) {
171  elses->accept(*this);
172  }
173 }

176 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_else_if_statement(const ElseIfStatement& node) {
177  if (!codegen) {
178  return;
179  }
180  printer->add_text(" else if (");
181  node.get_condition()->accept(*this);
182  printer->add_text(") ");
183  node.get_statement_block()->accept(*this);
184 }

187 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_else_statement(const ElseStatement& node) {
188  if (!codegen) {
189  return;
190  }
191  printer->add_text(" else ");
192  node.visit_children(*this);
193 }

196 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_while_statement(const WhileStatement& node) {
197  printer->add_text("while (");
198  node.get_condition()->accept(*this);
199  printer->add_text(") ");
200  node.get_statement_block()->accept(*this);
201 }

203 
204 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_from_statement(const ast::FromStatement& node) {
205  if (!codegen) {
206  return;
207  }
208  auto name = node.get_node_name();
209  const auto& from = node.get_from();
210  const auto& to = node.get_to();
211  const auto& inc = node.get_increment();
212  const auto& block = node.get_statement_block();
213  printer->fmt_text("for (int {} = ", name);
214  from->accept(*this);
215  printer->fmt_text("; {} <= ", name);
216  to->accept(*this);
217  if (inc) {
218  printer->fmt_text("; {} += ", name);
219  inc->accept(*this);
220  } else {
221  printer->fmt_text("; {}++", name);
222  }
223  printer->add_text(") ");
224  block->accept(*this);
225 }
226 
227 
228 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_paren_expression(const ParenExpression& node) {
229  if (!codegen) {
230  return;
231  }
232  printer->add_text("(");
233  node.get_expression()->accept(*this);
234  printer->add_text(")");
235 }
236 
237 
238 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_binary_expression(const BinaryExpression& node) {
239  if (!codegen) {
240  return;
241  }
242  auto op = node.get_op().eval();
243  const auto& lhs = node.get_lhs();
244  const auto& rhs = node.get_rhs();
245  if (op == "^") {
246  printer->add_text("pow(");
247  lhs->accept(*this);
248  printer->add_text(", ");
249  rhs->accept(*this);
250  printer->add_text(")");
251  } else {
252  lhs->accept(*this);
253  printer->add_text(" " + op + " ");
254  rhs->accept(*this);
255  }
256 }
257 
258 
259 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_binary_operator(const BinaryOperator& node) {
260  if (!codegen) {
261  return;
262  }
263  printer->add_text(node.eval());
264 }

267 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_unary_operator(const UnaryOperator& node) {
268  if (!codegen) {
269  return;
270  }
271  printer->add_text(" " + node.eval());
272 }

275 /**
276  * \details Statement block is top level construct (for every nmodl block).
277  * Sometime we want to analyse ast nodes even if code generation is
278  * false. Hence we visit children even if code generation is false.
279  */
280 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_statement_block(const StatementBlock& node) {
281  if (!codegen) {
282  node.visit_children(*this);
283  return;
284  }
285  print_statement_block(node);
286 }

296 
297 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_verbatim(const Verbatim& node) {
298  if (!codegen) {
299  return;
300  }
301  const auto& text = node.get_statement()->eval();
302  const auto& result = process_verbatim_text(text);
303 
304  const auto& statements = stringutils::split_string(result, '\n');
305  for (const auto& statement: statements) {
306  const auto& trimed_stmt = stringutils::trim_newline(statement);
307  if (trimed_stmt.find_first_not_of(' ') != std::string::npos) {
308  printer->add_line(trimed_stmt);
309  }
310  }
311 }
312 
313 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_update_dt(const ast::UpdateDt& node) {
314  // dt change statement should be pulled outside already
315 }
316 
317 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_protect_statement(const ast::ProtectStatement& node) {
318  print_atomic_reduction_pragma();
319  printer->add_indent();
320  node.get_expression()->accept(*this);
321  printer->add_text(";");
322 }
323 
324 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_mutex_lock(const ast::MutexLock& node) {
325  printer->fmt_line("#pragma omp critical ({})", info.mod_suffix);
326  printer->add_indent();
327  printer->push_block();
328 }
329 
330 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_mutex_unlock(const ast::MutexUnlock& node) {
331  printer->pop_block();
332 }

339 /**
340  * \details Certain statements like unit, comment, solve can/need to be skipped
341  * during code generation. Note that solve block is wrapped in expression
342  * statement and hence we have to check inner expression. It's also true
343  * for the initial block defined inside net receive block.
344  */
345 bool CodegenCppVisitor::statement_to_skip(const Statement& node) {
346  // clang-format off
347  if (node.is_unit_state()
348  || node.is_line_comment()
349  || node.is_block_comment()
350  || node.is_solve_block()
351  || node.is_conductance_hint()
352  || node.is_table_statement()) {
353  return true;
354  }
355  // clang-format on
356  if (node.is_expression_statement()) {
357  auto expression = dynamic_cast<const ExpressionStatement*>(&node)->get_expression();
358  if (expression->is_solve_block()) {
359  return true;
360  }
361  if (expression->is_initial_block()) {
362  return true;
363  }
364  }
365  return false;
366 }

369 bool CodegenCppVisitor::net_send_buffer_required() const noexcept {
370  if (net_receive_required() && !info.artificial_cell) {
371  if (info.net_event_used || info.net_send_used || info.is_watch_used()) {
372  return true;
373  }
374  }
375  return false;
376 }

421 int CodegenCppVisitor::position_of_float_var(const std::string& name) const {
422  int index = 0;
423  for (const auto& var: codegen_float_variables) {
424  if (var->get_name() == name) {
425  return index;
426  }
427  index += var->get_length();
428  }
429  throw std::logic_error(name + " variable not found");
430 }

432 
433 int CodegenCppVisitor::position_of_int_var(const std::string& name) const {
434  int index = 0;
435  for (const auto& var: codegen_int_variables) {
436  if (var.symbol->get_name() == name) {
437  return index;
438  }
439  index += var.symbol->get_length();
440  }
441  throw std::logic_error(name + " variable not found");
442 }

445 /**
446  * \details We can directly print value but if user specify value as integer then
447  * then it gets printed as an integer. To avoid this, we use below wrapper.
448  * If user has provided integer then it gets printed as 1.0 (similar to mod2c
449  * and neuron where ".0" is appended). Otherwise we print double variables as
450  * they are represented in the mod file by user. If the value is in scientific
451  * representation (1e+20, 1E-15) then keep it as it is.
452  */
453 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::format_double_string(const std::string& s_value) {
454  return utils::format_double_string<CodegenCppVisitor>(s_value);
455 }
456 
457 
458 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::format_float_string(const std::string& s_value) {
459  return utils::format_float_string<CodegenCppVisitor>(s_value);
460 }

463 /**
464  * \details Statements like if, else etc. don't need semicolon at the end.
465  * (Note that it's valid to have "extraneous" semicolon). Also, statement
466  * block can appear as statement using expression statement which need to
467  * be inspected.
468  */
469 bool CodegenCppVisitor::need_semicolon(const Statement& node) {
470  // clang-format off
471  if (node.is_if_statement()
472  || node.is_else_if_statement()
473  || node.is_else_statement()
474  || node.is_from_statement()
475  || node.is_verbatim()
476  || node.is_from_statement()
477  || node.is_conductance_hint()
478  || node.is_while_statement()
479  || node.is_protect_statement()
480  || node.is_mutex_lock()
481  || node.is_mutex_unlock()) {
482  return false;
483  }
484  if (node.is_expression_statement()) {
485  auto expression = dynamic_cast<const ExpressionStatement&>(node).get_expression();
486  if (expression->is_statement_block()
487  || expression->is_eigen_newton_solver_block()
488  || expression->is_eigen_linear_solver_block()
489  || expression->is_solution_expression()
490  || expression->is_for_netcon()) {
491  return false;
492  }
493  }
494  // clang-format on
495  return true;
496 }

499 // check if there is a function or procedure defined with given name
500 bool CodegenCppVisitor::defined_method(const std::string& name) const {
501  const auto& function = program_symtab->lookup(name);
502  auto properties = NmodlType::function_block | NmodlType::procedure_block;
503  return function && function->has_any_property(properties);
504 }

506 
507 /**
508  * \details Current variable used in breakpoint block could be local variable.
509  * In this case, neuron has already renamed the variable name by prepending
510  * "_l". In our implementation, the variable could have been renamed by
511  * one of the pass. And hence, we search all local variables and check if
512  * the variable is renamed. Note that we have to look into the symbol table
513  * of statement block and not breakpoint.
514  */
515 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::breakpoint_current(std::string current) const {
516  auto breakpoint = info.breakpoint_node;
517  if (breakpoint == nullptr) {
518  return current;
519  }
520  auto symtab = breakpoint->get_statement_block()->get_symbol_table();
521  auto variables = symtab->get_variables_with_properties(NmodlType::local_var);
522  for (const auto& var: variables) {
523  auto renamed_name = var->get_name();
524  auto original_name = var->get_original_name();
525  if (current == original_name) {
526  current = renamed_name;
527  break;
528  }
529  }
530  return current;
531 }

539 int CodegenCppVisitor::int_variables_size() const {
540  const auto count_semantics = [](int sum, const IndexSemantics& sem) { return sum += sem.size; };
541  return std::accumulate(info.semantics.begin(), info.semantics.end(), 0, count_semantics);
542 }

544 
545 /**
546  * \details Depending upon the block type, we have to print read/write ion variables
547  * during code generation. Depending on block/procedure being printed, this
548  * method return statements as vector. As different code backends could have
549  * different variable names, we rely on backend-specific read_ion_variable_name
550  * and write_ion_variable_name method which will be overloaded.
551  */
552 std::vector<std::string> CodegenCppVisitor::ion_read_statements(BlockType type) const {
553  if (optimize_ion_variable_copies()) {
554  return ion_read_statements_optimized(type);
555  }
556  std::vector<std::string> statements;
557  for (const auto& ion: info.ions) {
558  auto name = ion.name;
559  for (const auto& var: ion.reads) {
560  auto const iter = std::find(ion.implicit_reads.begin(), ion.implicit_reads.end(), var);
561  if (iter != ion.implicit_reads.end()) {
562  continue;
563  }
564  auto variable_names = read_ion_variable_name(var);
565  auto first = get_variable_name(variable_names.first);
566  auto second = get_variable_name(variable_names.second);
567  statements.push_back(fmt::format("{} = {};", first, second));
568  }
569  for (const auto& var: ion.writes) {
570  if (ion.is_ionic_conc(var)) {
571  auto variables = read_ion_variable_name(var);
572  auto first = get_variable_name(variables.first);
573  auto second = get_variable_name(variables.second);
574  statements.push_back(fmt::format("{} = {};", first, second));
575  }
576  }
577  }
578  return statements;
579 }
580 
581 
582 std::vector<std::string> CodegenCppVisitor::ion_read_statements_optimized(BlockType type) const {
583  std::vector<std::string> statements;
584  for (const auto& ion: info.ions) {
585  for (const auto& var: ion.writes) {
586  if (ion.is_ionic_conc(var)) {
587  auto variables = read_ion_variable_name(var);
588  auto first = "ionvar." + variables.first;
589  const auto& second = get_variable_name(variables.second);
590  statements.push_back(fmt::format("{} = {};", first, second));
591  }
592  }
593  }
594  return statements;
595 }
596 
597 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(readability-function-cognitive-complexity)
598 std::vector<ShadowUseStatement> CodegenCppVisitor::ion_write_statements(BlockType type) {
599  std::vector<ShadowUseStatement> statements;
600  for (const auto& ion: info.ions) {
601  std::string concentration;
602  auto name = ion.name;
603  for (const auto& var: ion.writes) {
604  auto variable_names = write_ion_variable_name(var);
605  if (ion.is_ionic_current(var)) {
606  if (type == BlockType::Equation) {
607  auto current = breakpoint_current(var);
608  auto lhs = variable_names.first;
609  auto op = "+=";
610  auto rhs = get_variable_name(current);
611  if (info.point_process) {
612  auto area = get_variable_name(naming::NODE_AREA_VARIABLE);
613  rhs += fmt::format("*(1.e2/{})", area);
614  }
615  statements.push_back(ShadowUseStatement{lhs, op, rhs});
616  }
617  } else {
618  if (!ion.is_rev_potential(var)) {
619  concentration = var;
620  }
621  auto lhs = variable_names.first;
622  auto op = "=";
623  auto rhs = get_variable_name(variable_names.second);
624  statements.push_back(ShadowUseStatement{lhs, op, rhs});
625  }
626  }
627 
628  if (type == BlockType::Initial && !concentration.empty()) {
629  int index = 0;
630  if (ion.is_intra_cell_conc(concentration)) {
631  index = 1;
632  } else if (ion.is_extra_cell_conc(concentration)) {
633  index = 2;
634  } else {
635  /// \todo Unhandled case in neuron implementation
636  throw std::logic_error(fmt::format("codegen error for {} ion", ion.name));
637  }
638  auto ion_type_name = fmt::format("{}_type", ion.name);
639  auto lhs = fmt::format("int {}", ion_type_name);
640  auto op = "=";
641  auto rhs = get_variable_name(ion_type_name);
642  statements.push_back(ShadowUseStatement{lhs, op, rhs});
643  auto statement = conc_write_statement(ion.name, concentration, index);
644  statements.push_back(ShadowUseStatement{statement, "", ""});
645  }
646  }
647  return statements;
648 }

650 
651 /**
652  * \details Often top level verbatim blocks use variables with old names.
653  * Here we process if we are processing verbatim block at global scope.
654  */
655 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::process_verbatim_token(const std::string& token) {
656  const std::string& name = token;
657 
658  /*
659  * If given token is procedure name and if it's defined
660  * in the current mod file then it must be replaced
661  */
662  if (program_symtab->is_method_defined(token)) {
663  return method_name(token);
664  }
665 
666  /*
667  * Check if token is commongly used variable name in
668  * verbatim block like nt, \c \_threadargs etc. If so, replace
669  * it and return.
670  */
671  auto new_name = replace_if_verbatim_variable(name);
672  if (new_name != name) {
673  return get_variable_name(new_name, false);
674  }
675 
676  /*
677  * For top level verbatim blocks we shouldn't replace variable
678  * names with Instance because arguments are provided from coreneuron
679  * and they are missing inst.
680  */
681  auto use_instance = !printing_top_verbatim_blocks;
682  return get_variable_name(token, use_instance);
683 }

686 bool CodegenCppVisitor::ion_variable_struct_required() const {

691 /**
692  * \details This can be override in the backend. For example, parameters can be constant
693  * except in INITIAL block where they are set to 0. As initial block is/can be
694  * executed on c++/cpu backend, gpu backend can mark the parameter as constant.
695  */
696 bool CodegenCppVisitor::is_constant_variable(const std::string& name) const {
697  auto symbol = program_symtab->lookup_in_scope(name);
698  bool is_constant = false;
699  if (symbol != nullptr) {
700  // per mechanism ion variables needs to be updated from neuron/coreneuron values
701  if (info.is_ion_variable(name)) {
702  is_constant = false;
703  }
704  // for parameter variable to be const, make sure it's write count is 0
705  // and it's not used in the verbatim block
706  else if (symbol->has_any_property(NmodlType::param_assign) &&
707  info.variables_in_verbatim.find(name) == info.variables_in_verbatim.end() &&
708  symbol->get_write_count() == 0) {
709  is_constant = true;
710  }
711  }
712  return is_constant;
713 }
714 
715 
716 /**
717  * \details Once variables are populated, update index semantics to register with coreneuron
718  */
719 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(readability-function-cognitive-complexity)
720 void CodegenCppVisitor::update_index_semantics() {
721  int index = 0;
722  info.semantics.clear();
723 
724  if (info.point_process) {
725  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, naming::AREA_SEMANTIC, 1);
726  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, naming::POINT_PROCESS_SEMANTIC, 1);
727  }
728  for (const auto& ion: info.ions) {
729  for (auto i = 0; i < ion.reads.size(); ++i) {
730  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, ion.name + "_ion", 1);
731  }
732  for (const auto& var: ion.writes) {
733  /// add if variable is not present in the read list
734  if (std::find(ion.reads.begin(), ion.reads.end(), var) == ion.reads.end()) {
735  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, ion.name + "_ion", 1);
736  }
737  if (ion.is_ionic_current(var)) {
738  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, ion.name + "_ion", 1);
739  }
740  }
741  if (ion.need_style) {
742  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, fmt::format("{}_ion", ion.name), 1);
743  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, fmt::format("#{}_ion", ion.name), 1);
744  }
745  }
746  for (auto& var: info.pointer_variables) {
747  if (info.first_pointer_var_index == -1) {
748  info.first_pointer_var_index = index;
749  }
750  int size = var->get_length();
751  if (var->has_any_property(NmodlType::pointer_var)) {
752  info.semantics.emplace_back(index, naming::POINTER_SEMANTIC, size);
753  } else {
754  info.semantics.emplace_back(index, naming::CORE_POINTER_SEMANTIC, size);
755  }
756  index += size;
757  }
758 
759  if (info.diam_used) {
760  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, naming::DIAM_VARIABLE, 1);
761  }
762 
763  if (info.area_used) {
764  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, naming::AREA_VARIABLE, 1);
765  }
766 
767  if (info.net_send_used) {
768  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, naming::NET_SEND_SEMANTIC, 1);
769  }
770 
771  /*
772  * Number of semantics for watch is one greater than number of
773  * actual watch statements in the mod file
774  */
775  if (!info.watch_statements.empty()) {
776  for (int i = 0; i < info.watch_statements.size() + 1; i++) {
777  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, naming::WATCH_SEMANTIC, 1);
778  }
779  }
780 
781  if (info.for_netcon_used) {
782  info.semantics.emplace_back(index++, naming::FOR_NETCON_SEMANTIC, 1);
783  }
784 }
785 
786 
787 std::vector<CodegenCppVisitor::SymbolType> CodegenCppVisitor::get_float_variables() const {
788  // sort with definition order
789  auto comparator = [](const SymbolType& first, const SymbolType& second) -> bool {
790  return first->get_definition_order() < second->get_definition_order();
791  };
792 
793  auto assigned = info.assigned_vars;
794  auto states = info.state_vars;
795 
796  // each state variable has corresponding Dstate variable
797  for (const auto& state: states) {
798  auto name = "D" + state->get_name();
799  auto symbol = make_symbol(name);
800  if (state->is_array()) {
801  symbol->set_as_array(state->get_length());
802  }
803  symbol->set_definition_order(state->get_definition_order());
804  assigned.push_back(symbol);
805  }
806  std::sort(assigned.begin(), assigned.end(), comparator);
807 
808  auto variables = info.range_parameter_vars;
809  variables.insert(variables.end(),
810  info.range_assigned_vars.begin(),
811  info.range_assigned_vars.end());
812  variables.insert(variables.end(), info.range_state_vars.begin(), info.range_state_vars.end());
813  variables.insert(variables.end(), assigned.begin(), assigned.end());
814 
815  if (info.vectorize) {
816  variables.push_back(make_symbol(naming::VOLTAGE_UNUSED_VARIABLE));
817  }
818 
819  if (breakpoint_exist()) {
820  std::string name = info.vectorize ? naming::CONDUCTANCE_UNUSED_VARIABLE
821  : naming::CONDUCTANCE_VARIABLE;
822 
823  // make sure conductance variable like `g` is not already defined
824  if (auto r = std::find_if(variables.cbegin(),
825  variables.cend(),
826  [&](const auto& s) { return name == s->get_name(); });
827  r == variables.cend()) {
828  variables.push_back(make_symbol(name));
829  }
830  }
831 
832  if (net_receive_exist()) {
833  variables.push_back(make_symbol(naming::T_SAVE_VARIABLE));
834  }
835  return variables;
836 }
837 
838 
839 /**
840  * IndexVariableInfo has following constructor arguments:
841  * - symbol
842  * - is_vdata (false)
843  * - is_index (false
844  * - is_integer (false)
845  *
846  * Which variables are constant qualified?
847  *
848  * - node area is read only
849  * - read ion variables are read only
850  * - style_ionname is index / offset
851  */
852 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(readability-function-cognitive-complexity)
853 std::vector<IndexVariableInfo> CodegenCppVisitor::get_int_variables() {
854  std::vector<IndexVariableInfo> variables;
855  if (info.point_process) {
856  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(naming::NODE_AREA_VARIABLE));
857  variables.back().is_constant = true;
858  /// note that this variable is not printed in neuron implementation
859  if (info.artificial_cell) {
860  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(naming::POINT_PROCESS_VARIABLE), true);
861  } else {
862  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(naming::POINT_PROCESS_VARIABLE), false, false, true);
863  variables.back().is_constant = true;
864  }
865  }
866 
867  for (auto& ion: info.ions) {
868  bool need_style = false;
869  std::unordered_map<std::string, int> ion_vars; // used to keep track of the variables to
870  // not have doubles between read/write. Same
871  // name variables are allowed
872  // See if we need to add extra readion statements to match NEURON with SoA data
873  auto const has_var = [&ion](const char* suffix) -> bool {
874  auto const pred = [name = ion.name + suffix](auto const& x) { return x == name; };
875  return std::any_of(ion.reads.begin(), ion.reads.end(), pred) ||
876  std::any_of(ion.writes.begin(), ion.writes.end(), pred);
877  };
878  auto const add_implicit_read = [&ion](const char* suffix) {
879  auto name = ion.name + suffix;
880  ion.reads.push_back(name);
881  ion.implicit_reads.push_back(std::move(name));
882  };
883  bool const have_ionin{has_var("i")}, have_ionout{has_var("o")};
884  if (have_ionin && !have_ionout) {
885  add_implicit_read("o");
886  } else if (have_ionout && !have_ionin) {
887  add_implicit_read("i");
888  }
889  for (const auto& var: ion.reads) {
890  const std::string name = naming::ION_VARNAME_PREFIX + var;
891  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(name));
892  variables.back().is_constant = true;
893  ion_vars[name] = static_cast<int>(variables.size() - 1);
894  }
895 
896  /// symbol for di_ion_dv var
897  std::shared_ptr<symtab::Symbol> ion_di_dv_var = nullptr;
898 
899  for (const auto& var: ion.writes) {
900  const std::string name = naming::ION_VARNAME_PREFIX + var;
901 
902  const auto ion_vars_it = ion_vars.find(name);
903  if (ion_vars_it != ion_vars.end()) {
904  variables[ion_vars_it->second].is_constant = false;
905  } else {
906  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(naming::ION_VARNAME_PREFIX + var));
907  }
908  if (ion.is_ionic_current(var)) {
909  ion_di_dv_var = make_symbol(std::string(naming::ION_VARNAME_PREFIX) + "di" +
910  ion.name + "dv");
911  }
912  if (ion.is_intra_cell_conc(var) || ion.is_extra_cell_conc(var)) {
913  need_style = true;
914  }
915  }
916 
917  /// insert after read/write variables but before style ion variable
918  if (ion_di_dv_var != nullptr) {
919  variables.emplace_back(ion_di_dv_var);
920  }
921 
922  if (need_style) {
923  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(naming::ION_VARNAME_PREFIX + ion.name + "_erev"));
924  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol("style_" + ion.name), false, true);
925  variables.back().is_constant = true;
926  }
927  }
928 
929  for (const auto& var: info.pointer_variables) {
930  auto name = var->get_name();
931  if (var->has_any_property(NmodlType::pointer_var)) {
932  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(name));
933  } else {
934  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(name), true);
935  }
936  }
937 
938  if (info.diam_used) {
939  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(naming::DIAM_VARIABLE));
940  }
941 
942  if (info.area_used) {
943  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(naming::AREA_VARIABLE));
944  }
945 
946  // for non-artificial cell, when net_receive buffering is enabled
947  // then tqitem is an offset
948  if (info.net_send_used) {
949  if (info.artificial_cell) {
950  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(naming::TQITEM_VARIABLE), true);
951  } else {
952  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(naming::TQITEM_VARIABLE), false, false, true);
953  variables.back().is_constant = true;
954  }
955  info.tqitem_index = static_cast<int>(variables.size() - 1);
956  }
957 
958  /**
959  * \note Variables for watch statements : there is one extra variable
960  * used in coreneuron compared to actual watch statements for compatibility
961  * with neuron (which uses one extra Datum variable)
962  */
963  if (!info.watch_statements.empty()) {
964  for (int i = 0; i < info.watch_statements.size() + 1; i++) {
965  variables.emplace_back(make_symbol(fmt::format("watch{}", i)), false, false, true);
966  }
967  }
968  return variables;
969 }

975 
976 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::get_parameter_str(const ParamVector& params) {
977  std::string str;
978  bool is_first = true;
979  for (const auto& param: params) {
980  if (is_first) {
981  is_first = false;
982  } else {
983  str += ", ";
984  }
985  str += fmt::format("{}{} {}{}",
986  std::get<0>(param),
987  std::get<1>(param),
988  std::get<2>(param),
989  std::get<3>(param));
990  }
991  return str;
992 }

1024  * \details Each kernel such as \c nrn\_init, \c nrn\_state and \c nrn\_cur could be offloaded
1025  * to accelerator. In this case, at very top level, we print pragma
1026  * for data present. For example:
1027  *
1028  * \code{.cpp}
1029  * void nrn_state(...) {
1030  * #pragma acc data present (nt, ml...)
1031  * {
1032  *
1033  * }
1034  * }
1035  * \endcode

1054 /**
1055  * \details Depending programming model and compiler, we print compiler hint
1056  * for parallelization. For example:
1057  *
1058  * \code
1059  * #pragma omp simd
1060  * for(int id = 0; id < nodecount; id++) {
1061  *
1062  * #pragma acc parallel loop
1063  * for(int id = 0; id < nodecount; id++) {
1064  * \endcode
1065  */
1066 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_channel_iteration_block_parallel_hint(BlockType /* type */,
1067  const ast::Block* block) {
1068  // ivdep allows SIMD parallelisation of a block/loop but doesn't provide
1069  // a standard mechanism for atomics. Also, even with openmp 5.0, openmp
1070  // atomics do not enable vectorisation under "omp simd" (gives compiler
1071  // error with gcc < 9 if atomic and simd pragmas are nested). So, emit
1072  // ivdep/simd pragma when no MUTEXLOCK/MUTEXUNLOCK/PROTECT statements
1073  // are used in the given block.
1074  std::vector<std::shared_ptr<const ast::Ast>> nodes;
1075  if (block) {
1076  nodes = collect_nodes(*block,
1077  {ast::AstNodeType::PROTECT_STATEMENT,
1078  ast::AstNodeType::MUTEX_LOCK,
1079  ast::AstNodeType::MUTEX_UNLOCK});
1080  }
1081  if (nodes.empty()) {
1082  printer->add_line("#pragma omp simd");
1083  printer->add_line("#pragma ivdep");
1084  }
1085 }

1170 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_memory_allocation_routine() const {
1171  printer->add_newline(2);
1172  auto args = "size_t num, size_t size, size_t alignment = 16";
1173  printer->fmt_push_block("static inline void* mem_alloc({})", args);
1174  printer->add_line("void* ptr;");
1175  printer->add_line("posix_memalign(&ptr, alignment, num*size);");
1176  printer->add_line("memset(ptr, 0, size);");
1177  printer->add_line("return ptr;");
1178  printer->pop_block();
1179 
1180  printer->add_newline(2);
1181  printer->push_block("static inline void mem_free(void* ptr)");
1182  printer->add_line("free(ptr);");
1183  printer->pop_block();
1184 }

1195 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::compute_method_name(BlockType type) const {
1196  if (type == BlockType::Initial) {
1197  return method_name(naming::NRN_INIT_METHOD);
1198  }
1199  if (type == BlockType::Constructor) {
1200  return method_name(naming::NRN_CONSTRUCTOR_METHOD);
1201  }
1202  if (type == BlockType::Destructor) {
1203  return method_name(naming::NRN_DESTRUCTOR_METHOD);
1204  }
1205  if (type == BlockType::State) {
1206  return method_name(naming::NRN_STATE_METHOD);
1207  }
1208  if (type == BlockType::Equation) {
1209  return method_name(naming::NRN_CUR_METHOD);
1210  }
1211  if (type == BlockType::Watch) {
1212  return method_name(naming::NRN_WATCH_CHECK_METHOD);
1213  }
1214  throw std::logic_error("compute_method_name not implemented");
1215 }

1231 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_watch_statement(const ast::WatchStatement& /* node */) {

1233  current_watch_statement++));

1236 
1237 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_statement_block(const ast::StatementBlock& node,
1238  bool open_brace,
1239  bool close_brace) {
1240  if (open_brace) {
1241  printer->push_block();
1242  }
1243 
1244  const auto& statements = node.get_statements();
1245  for (const auto& statement: statements) {
1246  if (statement_to_skip(*statement)) {
1247  continue;
1248  }
1249  /// not necessary to add indent for verbatim block (pretty-printing)
1250  if (!statement->is_verbatim() && !statement->is_mutex_lock() &&
1251  !statement->is_mutex_unlock() && !statement->is_protect_statement()) {
1252  printer->add_indent();
1253  }
1254  statement->accept(*this);
1255  if (need_semicolon(*statement)) {
1256  printer->add_text(';');
1257  }
1258  if (!statement->is_mutex_lock() && !statement->is_mutex_unlock()) {
1259  printer->add_newline();
1260  }
1261  }
1262 
1263  if (close_brace) {
1264  printer->pop_block_nl(0);
1265  }
1266 }
1267 
1268 
1269 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_function_call(const FunctionCall& node) {
1270  const auto& name = node.get_node_name();
1271  auto function_name = name;
1272  if (defined_method(name)) {
1273  function_name = method_name(name);
1274  }
1275 
1276  if (is_net_send(name)) {
1277  print_net_send_call(node);
1278  return;
1279  }
1280 
1281  if (is_net_move(name)) {
1282  print_net_move_call(node);
1283  return;
1284  }
1285 
1286  if (is_net_event(name)) {
1287  print_net_event_call(node);
1288  return;
1289  }
1290 
1291  const auto& arguments = node.get_arguments();
1292  printer->add_text(function_name, '(');
1293 
1294  if (defined_method(name)) {
1295  printer->add_text(internal_method_arguments());
1296  if (!arguments.empty()) {
1297  printer->add_text(", ");
1298  }
1299  }
1300 
1301  print_vector_elements(arguments, ", ");
1302  printer->add_text(')');
1303 }

1305 
1306 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_top_verbatim_blocks() {
1307  if (info.top_verbatim_blocks.empty()) {
1308  return;
1309  }
1310  print_namespace_stop();
1311 
1312  printer->add_newline(2);
1313  printer->add_line("using namespace coreneuron;");
1314  codegen = true;
1315  printing_top_verbatim_blocks = true;
1316 
1317  for (const auto& block: info.top_blocks) {
1318  if (block->is_verbatim()) {
1319  printer->add_newline(2);
1320  block->accept(*this);
1321  }
1322  }
1323 
1324  printing_top_verbatim_blocks = false;
1325  codegen = false;
1326  print_namespace_start();
1327 }
1328 
1329 
1330 /**
1331  * \todo Issue with verbatim renaming. e.g. pattern.mod has info struct with
1332  * index variable. If we use "index" instead of "indexes" as default argument
1333  * then during verbatim replacement we don't know the index is which one. This
1334  * is because verbatim renaming pass has already stripped out prefixes from
1335  * the text.
1336  */
1337 void CodegenCppVisitor::rename_function_arguments() {
1338  const auto& default_arguments = stringutils::split_string(nrn_thread_arguments(), ',');
1339  for (const auto& dirty_arg: default_arguments) {
1340  const auto& arg = stringutils::trim(dirty_arg);
1341  RenameVisitor v(arg, "arg_" + arg);
1342  for (const auto& function: info.functions) {
1343  if (has_parameter_of_name(function, arg)) {
1344  function->accept(v);
1345  }
1346  }
1347  for (const auto& function: info.procedures) {
1348  if (has_parameter_of_name(function, arg)) {
1349  function->accept(v);
1350  }
1351  }
1352  }
1353 }
1354 
1355 
1356 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_function_prototypes() {
1357  if (info.functions.empty() && info.procedures.empty()) {
1358  return;
1359  }
1360  codegen = true;
1361  printer->add_newline(2);
1362  for (const auto& node: info.functions) {
1363  print_function_declaration(*node, node->get_node_name());
1364  printer->add_text(';');
1365  printer->add_newline();
1366  }
1367  for (const auto& node: info.procedures) {
1368  print_function_declaration(*node, node->get_node_name());
1369  printer->add_text(';');
1370  printer->add_newline();
1371  }
1372  codegen = false;
1373 }

1375 
1376 static const TableStatement* get_table_statement(const ast::Block& node) {
1377  // TableStatementVisitor v;
1378 
1379  const auto& table_statements = collect_nodes(node, {AstNodeType::TABLE_STATEMENT});
1380 
1381  if (table_statements.size() != 1) {
1382  auto message = fmt::format("One table statement expected in {} found {}",
1383  node.get_node_name(),
1384  table_statements.size());
1385  throw std::runtime_error(message);
1386  }
1387  return dynamic_cast<const TableStatement*>(table_statements.front().get());
1388 }

1390 
1391 std::tuple<bool, int> CodegenCppVisitor::check_if_var_is_array(const std::string& name) {
1392  auto symbol = program_symtab->lookup_in_scope(name);
1393  if (!symbol) {
1394  throw std::runtime_error(
1395  fmt::format("CodegenCppVisitor:: {} not found in symbol table!", name));
1396  }
1397  if (symbol->is_array()) {
1398  return {true, symbol->get_length()};
1399  } else {
1400  return {false, 0};
1401  }
1402 }

1404 
1405 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_table_check_function(const Block& node) {
1406  auto statement = get_table_statement(node);
1407  auto table_variables = statement->get_table_vars();
1408  auto depend_variables = statement->get_depend_vars();
1409  const auto& from = statement->get_from();
1410  const auto& to = statement->get_to();
1411  auto name = node.get_node_name();
1412  auto internal_params = internal_method_parameters();
1413  auto with = statement->get_with()->eval();
1414  auto use_table_var = get_variable_name(naming::USE_TABLE_VARIABLE);
1415  auto tmin_name = get_variable_name("tmin_" + name);
1416  auto mfac_name = get_variable_name("mfac_" + name);
1417  auto float_type = default_float_data_type();
1418 
1419  printer->add_newline(2);
1420  print_device_method_annotation();
1421  printer->fmt_push_block("void check_{}({})",
1422  method_name(name),
1423  get_parameter_str(internal_params));
1424  {
1425  printer->fmt_push_block("if ({} == 0)", use_table_var);
1426  printer->add_line("return;");
1427  printer->pop_block();
1428 
1429  printer->add_line("static bool make_table = true;");
1430  for (const auto& variable: depend_variables) {
1431  printer->fmt_line("static {} save_{};", float_type, variable->get_node_name());
1432  }
1433 
1434  for (const auto& variable: depend_variables) {
1435  const auto& var_name = variable->get_node_name();
1436  const auto& instance_name = get_variable_name(var_name);
1437  printer->fmt_push_block("if (save_{} != {})", var_name, instance_name);
1438  printer->add_line("make_table = true;");
1439  printer->pop_block();
1440  }
1441 
1442  printer->push_block("if (make_table)");
1443  {
1444  printer->add_line("make_table = false;");
1445 
1446  printer->add_indent();
1447  printer->add_text(tmin_name, " = ");
1448  from->accept(*this);
1449  printer->add_text(';');
1450  printer->add_newline();
1451 
1452  printer->add_indent();
1453  printer->add_text("double tmax = ");
1454  to->accept(*this);
1455  printer->add_text(';');
1456  printer->add_newline();
1457 
1458 
1459  printer->fmt_line("double dx = (tmax-{}) / {}.;", tmin_name, with);
1460  printer->fmt_line("{} = 1./dx;", mfac_name);
1461 
1462  printer->fmt_line("double x = {};", tmin_name);
1463  printer->fmt_push_block("for (std::size_t i = 0; i < {}; x += dx, i++)", with + 1);
1464  auto function = method_name("f_" + name);
1465  if (node.is_procedure_block()) {
1466  printer->fmt_line("{}({}, x);", function, internal_method_arguments());
1467  for (const auto& variable: table_variables) {
1468  auto var_name = variable->get_node_name();
1469  auto instance_name = get_variable_name(var_name);
1470  auto table_name = get_variable_name("t_" + var_name);
1471  auto [is_array, array_length] = check_if_var_is_array(var_name);
1472  if (is_array) {
1473  for (int j = 0; j < array_length; j++) {
1474  printer->fmt_line(
1475  "{}[{}][i] = {}[{}];", table_name, j, instance_name, j);
1476  }
1477  } else {
1478  printer->fmt_line("{}[i] = {};", table_name, instance_name);
1479  }
1480  }
1481  } else {
1482  auto table_name = get_variable_name("t_" + name);
1483  printer->fmt_line("{}[i] = {}({}, x);",
1484  table_name,
1485  function,
1486  internal_method_arguments());
1487  }
1488  printer->pop_block();
1489 
1490  for (const auto& variable: depend_variables) {
1491  auto var_name = variable->get_node_name();
1492  auto instance_name = get_variable_name(var_name);
1493  printer->fmt_line("save_{} = {};", var_name, instance_name);
1494  }
1495  }
1496  printer->pop_block();
1497  }
1498  printer->pop_block();
1499 }

1501 
1502 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_table_replacement_function(const ast::Block& node) {
1503  auto name = node.get_node_name();
1504  auto statement = get_table_statement(node);
1505  auto table_variables = statement->get_table_vars();
1506  auto with = statement->get_with()->eval();
1507  auto use_table_var = get_variable_name(naming::USE_TABLE_VARIABLE);
1508  auto tmin_name = get_variable_name("tmin_" + name);
1509  auto mfac_name = get_variable_name("mfac_" + name);
1510  auto function_name = method_name("f_" + name);
1511 
1512  printer->add_newline(2);
1513  print_function_declaration(node, name);
1514  printer->push_block();
1515  {
1516  const auto& params = node.get_parameters();
1517  printer->fmt_push_block("if ({} == 0)", use_table_var);
1518  if (node.is_procedure_block()) {
1519  printer->fmt_line("{}({}, {});",
1520  function_name,
1521  internal_method_arguments(),
1522  params[0].get()->get_node_name());
1523  printer->add_line("return 0;");
1524  } else {
1525  printer->fmt_line("return {}({}, {});",
1526  function_name,
1527  internal_method_arguments(),
1528  params[0].get()->get_node_name());
1529  }
1530  printer->pop_block();
1531 
1532  printer->fmt_line("double xi = {} * ({} - {});",
1533  mfac_name,
1534  params[0].get()->get_node_name(),
1535  tmin_name);
1536  printer->push_block("if (isnan(xi))");
1537  if (node.is_procedure_block()) {
1538  for (const auto& var: table_variables) {
1539  auto var_name = get_variable_name(var->get_node_name());
1540  auto [is_array, array_length] = check_if_var_is_array(var->get_node_name());
1541  if (is_array) {
1542  for (int j = 0; j < array_length; j++) {
1543  printer->fmt_line("{}[{}] = xi;", var_name, j);
1544  }
1545  } else {
1546  printer->fmt_line("{} = xi;", var_name);
1547  }
1548  }
1549  printer->add_line("return 0;");
1550  } else {
1551  printer->add_line("return xi;");
1552  }
1553  printer->pop_block();
1554 
1555  printer->fmt_push_block("if (xi <= 0. || xi >= {}.)", with);
1556  printer->fmt_line("int index = (xi <= 0.) ? 0 : {};", with);
1557  if (node.is_procedure_block()) {
1558  for (const auto& variable: table_variables) {
1559  auto var_name = variable->get_node_name();
1560  auto instance_name = get_variable_name(var_name);
1561  auto table_name = get_variable_name("t_" + var_name);
1562  auto [is_array, array_length] = check_if_var_is_array(var_name);
1563  if (is_array) {
1564  for (int j = 0; j < array_length; j++) {
1565  printer->fmt_line(
1566  "{}[{}] = {}[{}][index];", instance_name, j, table_name, j);
1567  }
1568  } else {
1569  printer->fmt_line("{} = {}[index];", instance_name, table_name);
1570  }
1571  }
1572  printer->add_line("return 0;");
1573  } else {
1574  auto table_name = get_variable_name("t_" + name);
1575  printer->fmt_line("return {}[index];", table_name);
1576  }
1577  printer->pop_block();
1578 
1579  printer->add_line("int i = int(xi);");
1580  printer->add_line("double theta = xi - double(i);");
1581  if (node.is_procedure_block()) {
1582  for (const auto& var: table_variables) {
1583  auto var_name = var->get_node_name();
1584  auto instance_name = get_variable_name(var_name);
1585  auto table_name = get_variable_name("t_" + var_name);
1586  auto [is_array, array_length] = check_if_var_is_array(var->get_node_name());
1587  if (is_array) {
1588  for (size_t j = 0; j < array_length; j++) {
1589  printer->fmt_line(
1590  "{0}[{1}] = {2}[{1}][i] + theta*({2}[{1}][i+1]-{2}[{1}][i]);",
1591  instance_name,
1592  j,
1593  table_name);
1594  }
1595  } else {
1596  printer->fmt_line("{0} = {1}[i] + theta*({1}[i+1]-{1}[i]);",
1597  instance_name,
1598  table_name);
1599  }
1600  }
1601  printer->add_line("return 0;");
1602  } else {
1603  auto table_name = get_variable_name("t_" + name);
1604  printer->fmt_line("return {0}[i] + theta * ({0}[i+1] - {0}[i]);", table_name);
1605  }
1606  }
1607  printer->pop_block();
1608 }

1611 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_check_table_thread_function() {
1612  if (info.table_count == 0) {
1613  return;
1614  }
1615 
1616  printer->add_newline(2);
1617  auto name = method_name("check_table_thread");
1618  auto parameters = external_method_parameters(true);
1619 
1620  printer->fmt_push_block("static void {} ({})", name, parameters);
1621  printer->add_line("setup_instance(nt, ml);");
1622  printer->fmt_line("auto* const inst = static_cast<{0}*>(ml->instance);", instance_struct());
1623  printer->add_line("double v = 0;");
1624 
1625  for (const auto& function: info.functions_with_table) {
1626  auto method_name_str = method_name("check_" + function->get_node_name());
1627  auto arguments = internal_method_arguments();
1628  printer->fmt_line("{}({});", method_name_str, arguments);
1629  }
1630 
1631  printer->pop_block();
1632 }

1635 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_function_or_procedure(const ast::Block& node,
1636  const std::string& name) {
1637  printer->add_newline(2);
1638  print_function_declaration(node, name);
1639  printer->add_text(" ");
1640  printer->push_block();
1641 
1642  // function requires return variable declaration
1643  if (node.is_function_block()) {
1644  auto type = default_float_data_type();
1645  printer->fmt_line("{} ret_{} = 0.0;", type, name);
1646  } else {
1647  printer->fmt_line("int ret_{} = 0;", name);
1648  }
1649 
1650  print_statement_block(*node.get_statement_block(), false, false);
1651  printer->fmt_line("return ret_{};", name);
1652  printer->pop_block();
1653 }

1656 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_function_procedure_helper(const ast::Block& node) {
1657  codegen = true;
1658  auto name = node.get_node_name();
1659 
1660  if (info.function_uses_table(name)) {
1661  auto new_name = "f_" + name;
1662  print_function_or_procedure(node, new_name);
1663  print_table_check_function(node);
1664  print_table_replacement_function(node);
1665  } else {
1666  print_function_or_procedure(node, name);
1667  }
1668 
1669  codegen = false;
1670 }

1678 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_function(const ast::FunctionBlock& node) {
1679  auto name = node.get_node_name();
1680 
1681  // name of return variable
1682  std::string return_var;
1683  if (info.function_uses_table(name)) {
1684  return_var = "ret_f_" + name;
1685  } else {
1686  return_var = "ret_" + name;
1687  }
1688 
1689  // first rename return variable name
1690  auto block = node.get_statement_block().get();
1691  RenameVisitor v(name, return_var);
1692  block->accept(v);
1693 
1694  print_function_procedure_helper(node);
1695 }

1698 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_function_tables(const ast::FunctionTableBlock& node) {
1699  auto name = node.get_node_name();
1700  const auto& p = node.get_parameters();
1701  auto params = internal_method_parameters();
1702  for (const auto& i: p) {
1703  params.emplace_back("", "double", "", i->get_node_name());
1704  }
1705  printer->fmt_line("double {}({})", method_name(name), get_parameter_str(params));
1706  printer->push_block();
1707  printer->fmt_line("double _arg[{}];", p.size());
1708  for (size_t i = 0; i < p.size(); ++i) {
1709  printer->fmt_line("_arg[{}] = {};", i, p[i]->get_node_name());
1710  }
1711  printer->fmt_line("return hoc_func_table({}, {}, _arg);",
1712  get_variable_name(std::string("_ptable_" + name), true),
1713  p.size());
1714  printer->pop_block();
1715 
1716  printer->fmt_push_block("double table_{}()", method_name(name));
1717  printer->fmt_line("hoc_spec_table(&{}, {});",
1718  get_variable_name(std::string("_ptable_" + name)),
1719  p.size());
1720  printer->add_line("return 0.;");
1721  printer->pop_block();
1722 }
1723 
1724 /**
1725  * @brief Checks whether the functor_block generated by sympy solver modifies any variable outside
1726  * its scope. If it does then return false, so that the operator() of the struct functor of the
1727  * Eigen Newton solver doesn't have const qualifier.
1728  *
1729  * @param variable_block Statement Block of the variables declarations used in the functor struct of
1730  * the solver
1731  * @param functor_block Actual code being printed in the operator() of the functor struct of the
1732  * solver
1733  * @return True if operator() is const else False
1734  */
1735 bool is_functor_const(const ast::StatementBlock& variable_block,
1736  const ast::StatementBlock& functor_block) {
1737  // Create complete_block with both variable declarations (done in variable_block) and solver
1738  // part (done in functor_block) to be able to run the SymtabVisitor and DefUseAnalyzeVisitor
1739  // then and get the proper DUChains for the variables defined in the variable_block
1740  ast::StatementBlock complete_block(functor_block);
1741  // Typically variable_block has only one statement, a statement containing the declaration
1742  // of the local variables
1743  for (const auto& statement: variable_block.get_statements()) {
1744  complete_block.insert_statement(complete_block.get_statements().begin(), statement);
1745  }
1746 
1747  // Create Symbol Table for complete_block
1748  auto model_symbol_table = std::make_shared<symtab::ModelSymbolTable>();
1749  SymtabVisitor(model_symbol_table.get()).visit_statement_block(complete_block);
1750  // Initialize DefUseAnalyzeVisitor to generate the DUChains for the variables defined in the
1751  // variable_block
1752  DefUseAnalyzeVisitor v(*complete_block.get_symbol_table());
1753 
1754  // Check the DUChains for all the variables in the variable_block
1755  // If variable is defined in complete_block don't add const quilifier in operator()
1756  auto is_functor_const = true;
1757  const auto& variables = collect_nodes(variable_block, {ast::AstNodeType::LOCAL_VAR});
1758  for (const auto& variable: variables) {
1759  const auto& chain = v.analyze(complete_block, variable->get_node_name());
1760  is_functor_const = !(chain.eval() == DUState::D || chain.eval() == DUState::LD ||
1761  chain.eval() == DUState::CD);
1762  if (!is_functor_const) {
1763  break;
1764  }
1765  }
1766 
1767  return is_functor_const;
1768 }
1769 
1770 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_functor_definition(const ast::EigenNewtonSolverBlock& node) {
1771  // functor that evaluates F(X) and J(X) for
1772  // Newton solver
1773  auto float_type = default_float_data_type();
1774  int N = node.get_n_state_vars()->get_value();
1775 
1776  const auto functor_name = info.functor_names[&node];
1777  printer->fmt_push_block("struct {0}", functor_name);
1778  printer->add_line("NrnThread* nt;");
1779  printer->add_line(instance_struct(), "* inst;");
1780  printer->add_line("int id, pnodecount;");
1781  printer->add_line("double v;");
1782  printer->add_line("const Datum* indexes;");
1783  printer->add_line("double* data;");
1784  printer->add_line("ThreadDatum* thread;");
1785 
1786  if (ion_variable_struct_required()) {
1787  print_ion_variable();
1788  }
1789 
1790  print_statement_block(*node.get_variable_block(), false, false);
1791  printer->add_newline();
1792 
1793  printer->push_block("void initialize()");
1794  print_statement_block(*node.get_initialize_block(), false, false);
1795  printer->pop_block();
1796  printer->add_newline();
1797 
1798  printer->fmt_line(
1799  "{0}(NrnThread* nt, {1}* inst, int id, int pnodecount, double v, const Datum* indexes, "
1800  "double* data, ThreadDatum* thread) : "
1801  "nt{{nt}}, inst{{inst}}, id{{id}}, pnodecount{{pnodecount}}, v{{v}}, indexes{{indexes}}, "
1802  "data{{data}}, thread{{thread}} "
1803  "{{}}",
1804  functor_name,
1805  instance_struct());
1806 
1807  printer->add_indent();
1808 
1809  const auto& variable_block = *node.get_variable_block();
1810  const auto& functor_block = *node.get_functor_block();
1811 
1812  printer->fmt_text(
1813  "void operator()(const Eigen::Matrix<{0}, {1}, 1>& nmodl_eigen_xm, Eigen::Matrix<{0}, {1}, "
1814  "1>& nmodl_eigen_fm, "
1815  "Eigen::Matrix<{0}, {1}, {1}>& nmodl_eigen_jm) {2}",
1816  float_type,
1817  N,
1818  is_functor_const(variable_block, functor_block) ? "const " : "");
1819  printer->push_block();
1820  printer->fmt_line("const {}* nmodl_eigen_x = nmodl_eigen_xm.data();", float_type);
1821  printer->fmt_line("{}* nmodl_eigen_j = nmodl_eigen_jm.data();", float_type);
1822  printer->fmt_line("{}* nmodl_eigen_f = nmodl_eigen_fm.data();", float_type);
1823  print_statement_block(functor_block, false, false);
1824  printer->pop_block();
1825  printer->add_newline();
1826 
1827  // assign newton solver results in matrix X to state vars
1828  printer->push_block("void finalize()");
1829  print_statement_block(*node.get_finalize_block(), false, false);
1830  printer->pop_block();
1831 
1832  printer->pop_block(";");
1833 }
1834 
1835 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_eigen_newton_solver_block(const ast::EigenNewtonSolverBlock& node) {
1836  // solution vector to store copy of state vars for Newton solver
1837  printer->add_newline();
1838 
1839  auto float_type = default_float_data_type();
1840  int N = node.get_n_state_vars()->get_value();
1841  printer->fmt_line("Eigen::Matrix<{}, {}, 1> nmodl_eigen_xm;", float_type, N);
1842  printer->fmt_line("{}* nmodl_eigen_x = nmodl_eigen_xm.data();", float_type);
1843 
1844  print_statement_block(*node.get_setup_x_block(), false, false);
1845 
1846  // call newton solver with functor and X matrix that contains state vars
1847  printer->add_line("// call newton solver");
1848  printer->fmt_line("{} newton_functor(nt, inst, id, pnodecount, v, indexes, data, thread);",
1849  info.functor_names[&node]);
1850  printer->add_line("newton_functor.initialize();");
1851  printer->add_line(
1852  "int newton_iterations = nmodl::newton::newton_solver(nmodl_eigen_xm, newton_functor);");
1853  printer->add_line(
1854  "if (newton_iterations < 0) assert(false && \"Newton solver did not converge!\");");
1855 
1856  // assign newton solver results in matrix X to state vars
1857  print_statement_block(*node.get_update_states_block(), false, false);
1858  printer->add_line("newton_functor.finalize();");
1859 }
1860 
1861 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_eigen_linear_solver_block(const ast::EigenLinearSolverBlock& node) {
1862  printer->add_newline();
1863 
1864  const std::string float_type = default_float_data_type();
1865  int N = node.get_n_state_vars()->get_value();
1866  printer->fmt_line("Eigen::Matrix<{0}, {1}, 1> nmodl_eigen_xm, nmodl_eigen_fm;", float_type, N);
1867  printer->fmt_line("Eigen::Matrix<{0}, {1}, {1}> nmodl_eigen_jm;", float_type, N);
1868  if (N <= 4)
1869  printer->fmt_line("Eigen::Matrix<{0}, {1}, {1}> nmodl_eigen_jm_inv;", float_type, N);
1870  printer->fmt_line("{}* nmodl_eigen_x = nmodl_eigen_xm.data();", float_type);
1871  printer->fmt_line("{}* nmodl_eigen_j = nmodl_eigen_jm.data();", float_type);
1872  printer->fmt_line("{}* nmodl_eigen_f = nmodl_eigen_fm.data();", float_type);
1873  print_statement_block(*node.get_variable_block(), false, false);
1874  print_statement_block(*node.get_initialize_block(), false, false);
1875  print_statement_block(*node.get_setup_x_block(), false, false);
1876 
1877  printer->add_newline();
1878  print_eigen_linear_solver(float_type, N);
1879  printer->add_newline();
1880 
1881  print_statement_block(*node.get_update_states_block(), false, false);
1882  print_statement_block(*node.get_finalize_block(), false, false);
1883 }
1884 
1885 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_eigen_linear_solver(const std::string& float_type, int N) {
1886  if (N <= 4) {
1887  // Faster compared to LU, given the template specialization in Eigen.
1888  printer->add_multi_line(R"CODE(
1889  bool invertible;
1890  nmodl_eigen_jm.computeInverseWithCheck(nmodl_eigen_jm_inv,invertible);
1891  nmodl_eigen_xm = nmodl_eigen_jm_inv*nmodl_eigen_fm;
1892  if (!invertible) assert(false && "Singular or ill-conditioned matrix (Eigen::inverse)!");
1893  )CODE");
1894  } else {
1895  // In Eigen the default storage order is ColMajor.
1896  // Crout's implementation requires matrices stored in RowMajor order (C++-style arrays).
1897  // Therefore, the transposeInPlace is critical such that the data() method to give the rows
1898  // instead of the columns.
1899  printer->add_line("if (!nmodl_eigen_jm.IsRowMajor) nmodl_eigen_jm.transposeInPlace();");
1900 
1901  // pivot vector
1902  printer->fmt_line("Eigen::Matrix<int, {}, 1> pivot;", N);
1903  printer->fmt_line("Eigen::Matrix<{0}, {1}, 1> rowmax;", float_type, N);
1904 
1905  // In-place LU-Decomposition (Crout Algo) : Jm is replaced by its LU-decomposition
1906  printer->fmt_line(
1907  "if (nmodl::crout::Crout<{0}>({1}, nmodl_eigen_jm.data(), pivot.data(), rowmax.data()) "
1908  "< 0) assert(false && \"Singular or ill-conditioned matrix (nmodl::crout)!\");",
1909  float_type,
1910  N);
1911 
1912  // Solve the linear system : Forward/Backward substitution part
1913  printer->fmt_line(
1914  "nmodl::crout::solveCrout<{0}>({1}, nmodl_eigen_jm.data(), nmodl_eigen_fm.data(), "
1915  "nmodl_eigen_xm.data(), pivot.data());",
1916  float_type,
1917  N);
1918  }
1919 }

1940  params.emplace_back("", "int", "", "pnodecount");

1947  params.emplace_back("", "ThreadDatum*", "", "thread");
1948  params.emplace_back("", "NrnThread*", "", "nt");
1949  params.emplace_back("", "double", "", "v");

1989 /**
1990  * Replace commonly used variables in the verbatim blocks into their corresponding
1991  * variable name in the new code generation backend.
1992  */
1993 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::replace_if_verbatim_variable(std::string name) {
1994  if (naming::VERBATIM_VARIABLES_MAPPING.find(name) != naming::VERBATIM_VARIABLES_MAPPING.end()) {
1995  name = naming::VERBATIM_VARIABLES_MAPPING.at(name);
1996  }
1997 
1998  /**
1999  * if function is defined the same mod file then the arguments must
2000  * contain mechanism instance as well.
2001  */
2002  if (name == naming::THREAD_ARGS) {
2003  if (internal_method_call_encountered) {
2004  name = nrn_thread_internal_arguments();
2005  internal_method_call_encountered = false;
2006  } else {
2007  name = nrn_thread_arguments();
2008  }
2009  }
2010  if (name == naming::THREAD_ARGS_PROTO) {
2011  name = external_method_parameters();
2012  }
2013  return name;
2014 }
2015 
2016 
2017 /**
2018  * Processing commonly used constructs in the verbatim blocks.
2019  * @todo : this is still ad-hoc and requires re-implementation to
2020  * handle it more elegantly.
2021  */
2022 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::process_verbatim_text(std::string const& text) {
2023  parser::CDriver driver;
2024  driver.scan_string(text);
2025  auto tokens = driver.all_tokens();
2026  std::string result;
2027  for (size_t i = 0; i < tokens.size(); i++) {
2028  auto token = tokens[i];
2029 
2030  // check if we have function call in the verbatim block where
2031  // function is defined in the same mod file
2032  if (program_symtab->is_method_defined(token) && tokens[i + 1] == "(") {
2033  internal_method_call_encountered = true;
2034  }
2035  auto name = process_verbatim_token(token);
2036 
2037  if (token == (std::string("_") + naming::TQITEM_VARIABLE)) {
2038  name.insert(0, 1, '&');
2039  }
2040  if (token == "_STRIDE") {
2041  name = "pnodecount+id";
2042  }
2043  result += name;
2044  }
2045  return result;
2046 }

2051  auto nrn_state = nrn_state_required() ? method_name(naming::NRN_STATE_METHOD) : "nullptr";
2052  auto nrn_alloc = method_name(naming::NRN_ALLOC_METHOD);

2056  return fmt::format("mechanism, {}, {}, nullptr, {}, {}, {}, {}, first_pointer_var_index()",
2057  nrn_alloc,
2058  nrn_cur,
2059  nrn_state,
2060  nrn_init,
2061  nrn_private_constructor,
2062  nrn_private_destructor);
2063 }

2100 /**
2101  * If mechanisms dependency level execution is enabled then certain updates
2102  * like ionic current contributions needs to be atomically updated. In this
2103  * case we first update current mechanism's shadow vector and then add statement
2104  * to queue that will be used in reduction queue.
2105  */
2106 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::process_shadow_update_statement(const ShadowUseStatement& statement,
2107  BlockType /* type */) {
2108  // when there is no operator or rhs then that statement doesn't need shadow update
2109  if (statement.op.empty() && statement.rhs.empty()) {
2110  auto text = statement.lhs + ";";
2111  return text;
2112  }
2113 
2114  // return regular statement
2115  auto lhs = get_variable_name(statement.lhs);
2116  auto text = fmt::format("{} {} {};", lhs, statement.op, statement.rhs);
2117  return text;
2118 }

2211 /**
2212  * \details There are three types of thread variables currently considered:
2213  * - top local thread variables
2214  * - thread variables in the mod file
2215  * - thread variables for solver
2216  *
2217  * These variables are allocated into different thread structures and have
2218  * corresponding thread ids. Thread id start from 0. In mod2c implementation,
2219  * thread_data_index is increased at various places and it is used to
2220  * decide the index of thread.
2221  */
2222 
2223 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_thread_getters() {
2224  if (info.vectorize && info.derivimplicit_used()) {
2225  int tid = info.derivimplicit_var_thread_id;
2226  int list = info.derivimplicit_list_num;
2227 
2228  // clang-format off
2229  printer->add_newline(2);
2230  printer->add_line("/** thread specific helper routines for derivimplicit */");
2231 
2232  printer->add_newline(1);
2233  printer->fmt_push_block("static inline int* deriv{}_advance(ThreadDatum* thread)", list);
2234  printer->fmt_line("return &(thread[{}].i);", tid);
2235  printer->pop_block();
2236  printer->add_newline();
2237 
2238  printer->fmt_push_block("static inline int dith{}()", list);
2239  printer->fmt_line("return {};", tid+1);
2240  printer->pop_block();
2241  printer->add_newline();
2242 
2243  printer->fmt_push_block("static inline void** newtonspace{}(ThreadDatum* thread)", list);
2244  printer->fmt_line("return &(thread[{}]._pvoid);", tid+2);
2245  printer->pop_block();
2246  }
2247 
2248  if (info.vectorize && !info.thread_variables.empty()) {
2249  printer->add_newline(2);
2250  printer->add_line("/** tid for thread variables */");
2251  printer->push_block("static inline int thread_var_tid()");
2252  printer->fmt_line("return {};", info.thread_var_thread_id);
2253  printer->pop_block();
2254  }
2255 
2256  if (info.vectorize && !info.top_local_variables.empty()) {
2257  printer->add_newline(2);
2258  printer->add_line("/** tid for top local tread variables */");
2259  printer->push_block("static inline int top_local_var_tid()");
2260  printer->fmt_line("return {};", info.top_local_thread_id);
2261  printer->pop_block();
2262  }
2263  // clang-format on
2264 }

2267 /****************************************************************************************/
2268 /* Routines for returning variable name */
2269 /****************************************************************************************/
2270 
2271 
2272 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::float_variable_name(const SymbolType& symbol,
2273  bool use_instance) const {
2274  auto name = symbol->get_name();
2275  auto dimension = symbol->get_length();
2276  auto position = position_of_float_var(name);
2277  // clang-format off
2278  if (symbol->is_array()) {
2279  if (use_instance) {
2280  return fmt::format("(inst->{}+id*{})", name, dimension);
2281  }
2282  return fmt::format("(data + {}*pnodecount + id*{})", position, dimension);
2283  }
2284  if (use_instance) {
2285  return fmt::format("inst->{}[id]", name);
2286  }
2287  return fmt::format("data[{}*pnodecount + id]", position);
2288  // clang-format on
2289 }
2290 
2291 
2292 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::int_variable_name(const IndexVariableInfo& symbol,
2293  const std::string& name,
2294  bool use_instance) const {
2295  auto position = position_of_int_var(name);
2296  // clang-format off
2297  if (symbol.is_index) {
2298  if (use_instance) {
2299  return fmt::format("inst->{}[{}]", name, position);
2300  }
2301  return fmt::format("indexes[{}]", position);
2302  }
2303  if (symbol.is_integer) {
2304  if (use_instance) {
2305  return fmt::format("inst->{}[{}*pnodecount+id]", name, position);
2306  }
2307  return fmt::format("indexes[{}*pnodecount+id]", position);
2308  }
2309  if (use_instance) {
2310  return fmt::format("inst->{}[indexes[{}*pnodecount + id]]", name, position);
2311  }
2312  auto data = symbol.is_vdata ? "_vdata" : "_data";
2313  return fmt::format("nt->{}[indexes[{}*pnodecount + id]]", data, position);
2314  // clang-format on
2315 }

2318 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::global_variable_name(const SymbolType& symbol,
2319  bool use_instance) const {
2320  if (use_instance) {
2321  return fmt::format("inst->{}->{}", naming::INST_GLOBAL_MEMBER, symbol->get_name());
2322  } else {
2323  return fmt::format("{}.{}", global_struct_instance(), symbol->get_name());
2324  }
2325 }

2328 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::update_if_ion_variable_name(const std::string& name) const {
2329  std::string result(name);
2330  if (ion_variable_struct_required()) {
2331  if (info.is_ion_read_variable(name)) {
2332  result = naming::ION_VARNAME_PREFIX + name;
2333  }
2334  if (info.is_ion_write_variable(name)) {
2335  result = "ionvar." + name;
2336  }
2337  if (info.is_current(name)) {
2338  result = "ionvar." + name;
2339  }
2340  }
2341  return result;
2342 }
2343 
2344 
2345 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::get_variable_name(const std::string& name, bool use_instance) const {
2346  const std::string& varname = update_if_ion_variable_name(name);
2347 
2348  // clang-format off
2349  auto symbol_comparator = [&varname](const SymbolType& sym) {
2350  return varname == sym->get_name();
2351  };
2352 
2353  auto index_comparator = [&varname](const IndexVariableInfo& var) {
2354  return varname == var.symbol->get_name();
2355  };
2356  // clang-format on
2357 
2358  // float variable
2359  auto f = std::find_if(codegen_float_variables.begin(),
2360  codegen_float_variables.end(),
2361  symbol_comparator);
2362  if (f != codegen_float_variables.end()) {
2363  return float_variable_name(*f, use_instance);
2364  }
2365 
2366  // integer variable
2367  auto i =
2368  std::find_if(codegen_int_variables.begin(), codegen_int_variables.end(), index_comparator);
2369  if (i != codegen_int_variables.end()) {
2370  return int_variable_name(*i, varname, use_instance);
2371  }
2372 
2373  // global variable
2374  auto g = std::find_if(codegen_global_variables.begin(),
2375  codegen_global_variables.end(),
2376  symbol_comparator);
2377  if (g != codegen_global_variables.end()) {
2378  return global_variable_name(*g, use_instance);
2379  }
2380 
2381  if (varname == naming::NTHREAD_DT_VARIABLE) {
2382  return std::string("nt->_") + naming::NTHREAD_DT_VARIABLE;
2383  }
2384 
2385  // t in net_receive method is an argument to function and hence it should
2386  // ne used instead of nt->_t which is current time of thread
2387  if (varname == naming::NTHREAD_T_VARIABLE && !printing_net_receive) {
2388  return std::string("nt->_") + naming::NTHREAD_T_VARIABLE;
2389  }
2390 
2391  auto const iter =
2392  std::find_if(info.neuron_global_variables.begin(),
2393  info.neuron_global_variables.end(),
2394  [&varname](auto const& entry) { return entry.first->get_name() == varname; });
2395  if (iter != info.neuron_global_variables.end()) {
2396  std::string ret;
2397  if (use_instance) {
2398  ret = "*(inst->";
2399  }
2400  ret.append(varname);
2401  if (use_instance) {
2402  ret.append(")");
2403  }
2404  return ret;
2405  }
2406 
2407  // otherwise return original name
2408  return varname;
2409 }

2447 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_coreneuron_includes() {
2448  printer->add_newline();
2449  printer->add_multi_line(R"CODE(
2450  #include <coreneuron/gpu/nrn_acc_manager.hpp>
2451  #include <coreneuron/mechanism/mech/mod2c_core_thread.hpp>
2452  #include <coreneuron/mechanism/register_mech.hpp>
2453  #include <coreneuron/nrnconf.h>
2454  #include <coreneuron/nrniv/nrniv_decl.h>
2455  #include <coreneuron/sim/multicore.hpp>
2456  #include <coreneuron/sim/scopmath/newton_thread.hpp>
2457  #include <coreneuron/utils/ivocvect.hpp>
2458  #include <coreneuron/utils/nrnoc_aux.hpp>
2459  #include <coreneuron/utils/randoms/nrnran123.h>
2460  )CODE");
2461  if (info.eigen_newton_solver_exist) {
2462  printer->add_line("#include <newton/newton.hpp>");
2463  }
2464  if (info.eigen_linear_solver_exist) {
2465  if (std::accumulate(info.state_vars.begin(),
2466  info.state_vars.end(),
2467  0,
2468  [](int l, const SymbolType& variable) {
2469  return l += variable->get_length();
2470  }) > 4) {
2471  printer->add_line("#include <crout/crout.hpp>");
2472  } else {
2473  printer->add_line("#include <Eigen/Dense>");
2474  printer->add_line("#include <Eigen/LU>");
2475  }
2476  }
2477 }
2478 
2479 
2480 /**
2481  * \details Variables required for type of ion, type of point process etc. are
2482  * of static int type. For the C++ backend type, it's ok to have
2483  * these variables as file scoped static variables.
2484  *
2485  * Initial values of state variables (h0) are also defined as static
2486  * variables. Note that the state could be ion variable and it could
2487  * be also range variable. Hence lookup into symbol table before.
2488  *
2489  * When model is not vectorized (shouldn't be the case in coreneuron)
2490  * the top local variables become static variables.
2491  *
2492  * Note that static variables are already initialized to 0. We do the
2493  * same for some variables to keep same code as neuron.
2494  */
2495 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(readability-function-cognitive-complexity)
2496 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_mechanism_global_var_structure(bool print_initializers) {
2497  const auto value_initialize = print_initializers ? "{}" : "";
2498  const auto qualifier = global_var_struct_type_qualifier();
2499 
2500  auto float_type = default_float_data_type();
2501  printer->add_newline(2);
2502  printer->add_line("/** all global variables */");
2503  printer->fmt_push_block("struct {}", global_struct());
2504 
2505  for (const auto& ion: info.ions) {
2506  auto name = fmt::format("{}_type", ion.name);
2507  printer->fmt_line("{}int {}{};", qualifier, name, value_initialize);
2508  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol(name));
2509  }
2510 
2511  if (info.point_process) {
2512  printer->fmt_line("{}int point_type{};", qualifier, value_initialize);
2513  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("point_type"));
2514  }
2515 
2516  for (const auto& var: info.state_vars) {
2517  auto name = var->get_name() + "0";
2518  auto symbol = program_symtab->lookup(name);
2519  if (symbol == nullptr) {
2520  printer->fmt_line("{}{} {}{};", qualifier, float_type, name, value_initialize);
2521  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol(name));
2522  }
2523  }
2524 
2525  // Neuron and Coreneuron adds "v" to global variables when vectorize
2526  // is false. But as v is always local variable and passed as argument,
2527  // we don't need to use global variable v
2528 
2529  auto& top_locals = info.top_local_variables;
2530  if (!info.vectorize && !top_locals.empty()) {
2531  for (const auto& var: top_locals) {
2532  auto name = var->get_name();
2533  auto length = var->get_length();
2534  if (var->is_array()) {
2535  printer->fmt_line("{}{} {}[{}] /* TODO init top-local-array */;",
2536  qualifier,
2537  float_type,
2538  name,
2539  length);
2540  } else {
2541  printer->fmt_line("{}{} {} /* TODO init top-local */;",
2542  qualifier,
2543  float_type,
2544  name);
2545  }
2546  codegen_global_variables.push_back(var);
2547  }
2548  }
2549 
2550  if (!info.thread_variables.empty()) {
2551  printer->fmt_line("{}int thread_data_in_use{};", qualifier, value_initialize);
2552  printer->fmt_line("{}{} thread_data[{}] /* TODO init thread_data */;",
2553  qualifier,
2554  float_type,
2555  info.thread_var_data_size);
2556  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("thread_data_in_use"));
2557  auto symbol = make_symbol("thread_data");
2558  symbol->set_as_array(info.thread_var_data_size);
2559  codegen_global_variables.push_back(symbol);
2560  }
2561 
2562  // TODO: remove this entirely?
2563  printer->fmt_line("{}int reset{};", qualifier, value_initialize);
2564  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("reset"));
2565 
2566  printer->fmt_line("{}int mech_type{};", qualifier, value_initialize);
2567  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("mech_type"));
2568 
2569  for (const auto& var: info.global_variables) {
2570  auto name = var->get_name();
2571  auto length = var->get_length();
2572  if (var->is_array()) {
2573  printer->fmt_line(
2574  "{}{} {}[{}] /* TODO init const-array */;", qualifier, float_type, name, length);
2575  } else {
2576  double value{};
2577  if (auto const& value_ptr = var->get_value()) {
2578  value = *value_ptr;
2579  }
2580  printer->fmt_line("{}{} {}{};",
2581  qualifier,
2582  float_type,
2583  name,
2584  print_initializers ? fmt::format("{{{:g}}}", value) : std::string{});
2585  }
2586  codegen_global_variables.push_back(var);
2587  }
2588 
2589  for (const auto& var: info.constant_variables) {
2590  auto const name = var->get_name();
2591  auto* const value_ptr = var->get_value().get();
2592  double const value{value_ptr ? *value_ptr : 0};
2593  printer->fmt_line("{}{} {}{};",
2594  qualifier,
2595  float_type,
2596  name,
2597  print_initializers ? fmt::format("{{{:g}}}", value) : std::string{});
2598  codegen_global_variables.push_back(var);
2599  }
2600 
2601  if (info.primes_size != 0) {
2602  if (info.primes_size != info.prime_variables_by_order.size()) {
2603  throw std::runtime_error{
2604  fmt::format("primes_size = {} differs from prime_variables_by_order.size() = {}, "
2605  "this should not happen.",
2606  info.primes_size,
2607  info.prime_variables_by_order.size())};
2608  }
2609  auto const initializer_list = [&](auto const& primes, const char* prefix) -> std::string {
2610  if (!print_initializers) {
2611  return {};
2612  }
2613  std::string list{"{"};
2614  for (auto iter = primes.begin(); iter != primes.end(); ++iter) {
2615  auto const& prime = *iter;
2616  list.append(std::to_string(position_of_float_var(prefix + prime->get_name())));
2617  if (std::next(iter) != primes.end()) {
2618  list.append(", ");
2619  }
2620  }
2621  list.append("}");
2622  return list;
2623  };
2624  printer->fmt_line("{}int slist1[{}]{};",
2625  qualifier,
2626  info.primes_size,
2627  initializer_list(info.prime_variables_by_order, ""));
2628  printer->fmt_line("{}int dlist1[{}]{};",
2629  qualifier,
2630  info.primes_size,
2631  initializer_list(info.prime_variables_by_order, "D"));
2632  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("slist1"));
2633  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("dlist1"));
2634  // additional list for derivimplicit method
2635  if (info.derivimplicit_used()) {
2636  auto primes = program_symtab->get_variables_with_properties(NmodlType::prime_name);
2637  printer->fmt_line("{}int slist2[{}]{};",
2638  qualifier,
2639  info.primes_size,
2640  initializer_list(primes, ""));
2641  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("slist2"));
2642  }
2643  }
2644 
2645  if (info.table_count > 0) {
2646  printer->fmt_line("{}double usetable{};", qualifier, print_initializers ? "{1}" : "");
2647  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol(naming::USE_TABLE_VARIABLE));
2648 
2649  for (const auto& block: info.functions_with_table) {
2650  const auto& name = block->get_node_name();
2651  printer->fmt_line("{}{} tmin_{}{};", qualifier, float_type, name, value_initialize);
2652  printer->fmt_line("{}{} mfac_{}{};", qualifier, float_type, name, value_initialize);
2653  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("tmin_" + name));
2654  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("mfac_" + name));
2655  }
2656 
2657  for (const auto& variable: info.table_statement_variables) {
2658  auto const name = "t_" + variable->get_name();
2659  auto const num_values = variable->get_num_values();
2660  if (variable->is_array()) {
2661  int array_len = variable->get_length();
2662  printer->fmt_line("{}{} {}[{}][{}]{};",
2663  qualifier,
2664  float_type,
2665  name,
2666  array_len,
2667  num_values,
2668  value_initialize);
2669  } else {
2670  printer->fmt_line(
2671  "{}{} {}[{}]{};", qualifier, float_type, name, num_values, value_initialize);
2672  }
2673  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol(name));
2674  }
2675  }
2676 
2677  for (const auto& f: info.function_tables) {
2678  printer->fmt_line("void* _ptable_{}{{}};", f->get_node_name());
2679  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("_ptable_" + f->get_node_name()));
2680  }
2681 
2682  if (info.vectorize && info.thread_data_index) {
2683  printer->fmt_line("{}ThreadDatum ext_call_thread[{}]{};",
2684  qualifier,
2685  info.thread_data_index,
2686  value_initialize);
2687  codegen_global_variables.push_back(make_symbol("ext_call_thread"));
2688  }
2689 
2690  printer->pop_block(";");
2691 
2692  print_global_var_struct_assertions();
2693  print_global_var_struct_decl();
2694 }
2695 
2696 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_global_var_struct_assertions() const {
2697  // Assert some things that we assume when copying instances of this struct
2698  // to the GPU and so on.
2699  printer->fmt_line("static_assert(std::is_trivially_copy_constructible_v<{}>);",
2700  global_struct());
2701  printer->fmt_line("static_assert(std::is_trivially_move_constructible_v<{}>);",
2702  global_struct());
2703  printer->fmt_line("static_assert(std::is_trivially_copy_assignable_v<{}>);", global_struct());
2704  printer->fmt_line("static_assert(std::is_trivially_move_assignable_v<{}>);", global_struct());
2705  printer->fmt_line("static_assert(std::is_trivially_destructible_v<{}>);", global_struct());
2706 }

2716 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_mechanism_info() {
2717  auto variable_printer = [&](const std::vector<SymbolType>& variables) {
2718  for (const auto& v: variables) {
2719  auto name = v->get_name();
2720  if (!info.point_process) {
2721  name += "_" + info.mod_suffix;
2722  }
2723  if (v->is_array()) {
2724  name += fmt::format("[{}]", v->get_length());
2725  }
2726  printer->add_line(add_escape_quote(name), ",");
2727  }
2728  };
2729 
2730  printer->add_newline(2);
2731  printer->add_line("/** channel information */");
2732  printer->add_line("static const char *mechanism[] = {");
2733  printer->increase_indent();
2734  printer->add_line(add_escape_quote(nmodl_version()), ",");
2735  printer->add_line(add_escape_quote(info.mod_suffix), ",");
2736  variable_printer(info.range_parameter_vars);
2737  printer->add_line("0,");
2738  variable_printer(info.range_assigned_vars);
2739  printer->add_line("0,");
2740  variable_printer(info.range_state_vars);
2741  printer->add_line("0,");
2742  variable_printer(info.pointer_variables);
2743  printer->add_line("0");
2744  printer->decrease_indent();
2745  printer->add_line("};");
2746 }
