2749 /**
2750  * Print structs that encapsulate information about scalar and
2751  * vector elements of type global and thread variables.
2752  */
2753 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_global_variables_for_hoc() {
2754  auto variable_printer =
2755  [&](const std::vector<SymbolType>& variables, bool if_array, bool if_vector) {
2756  for (const auto& variable: variables) {
2757  if (variable->is_array() == if_array) {
2758  // false => do not use the instance struct, which is not
2759  // defined in the global declaration that we are printing
2760  auto name = get_variable_name(variable->get_name(), false);
2761  auto ename = add_escape_quote(variable->get_name() + "_" + info.mod_suffix);
2762  auto length = variable->get_length();
2763  if (if_vector) {
2764  printer->fmt_line("{{{}, {}, {}}},", ename, name, length);
2765  } else {
2766  printer->fmt_line("{{{}, &{}}},", ename, name);
2767  }
2768  }
2769  }
2770  };
2771 
2772  auto globals = info.global_variables;
2773  auto thread_vars = info.thread_variables;
2774 
2775  if (info.table_count > 0) {
2776  globals.push_back(make_symbol(naming::USE_TABLE_VARIABLE));
2777  }
2778 
2779  printer->add_newline(2);
2780  printer->add_line("/** connect global (scalar) variables to hoc -- */");
2781  printer->add_line("static DoubScal hoc_scalar_double[] = {");
2782  printer->increase_indent();
2783  variable_printer(globals, false, false);
2784  variable_printer(thread_vars, false, false);
2785  printer->add_line("{nullptr, nullptr}");
2786  printer->decrease_indent();
2787  printer->add_line("};");
2788 
2789  printer->add_newline(2);
2790  printer->add_line("/** connect global (array) variables to hoc -- */");
2791  printer->add_line("static DoubVec hoc_vector_double[] = {");
2792  printer->increase_indent();
2793  variable_printer(globals, true, true);
2794  variable_printer(thread_vars, true, true);
2795  printer->add_line("{nullptr, nullptr, 0}");
2796  printer->decrease_indent();
2797  printer->add_line("};");
2798 }
2799 
2800 /**
2801  * Return registration type for a given BEFORE/AFTER block
2802  * /param block A BEFORE/AFTER block being registered
2803  *
2804  * Depending on a block type i.e. BEFORE or AFTER and also type
2805  * of it's associated block i.e. BREAKPOINT, INITIAL, SOLVE and
2806  * STEP, the registration type (as an integer) is calculated.
2807  * These values are then interpreted by CoreNEURON internally.
2808  */
2809 static std::string get_register_type_for_ba_block(const ast::Block* block) {
2810  std::string register_type{};
2811  BAType ba_type{};
2812  /// before block have value 10 and after block 20
2813  if (block->is_before_block()) {
2814  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cppcoreguidelines-avoid-magic-numbers,readability-magic-numbers)
2815  register_type = "BAType::Before";
2816  ba_type =
2817  dynamic_cast<const ast::BeforeBlock*>(block)->get_bablock()->get_type()->get_value();
2818  } else {
2819  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cppcoreguidelines-avoid-magic-numbers,readability-magic-numbers)
2820  register_type = "BAType::After";
2821  ba_type =
2822  dynamic_cast<const ast::AfterBlock*>(block)->get_bablock()->get_type()->get_value();
2823  }
2824 
2825  /// associated blocks have different values (1 to 4) based on type.
2826  /// These values are based on neuron/coreneuron implementation details.
2827  if (ba_type == BATYPE_BREAKPOINT) {
2828  register_type += " + BAType::Breakpoint";
2829  } else if (ba_type == BATYPE_SOLVE) {
2830  register_type += " + BAType::Solve";
2831  } else if (ba_type == BATYPE_INITIAL) {
2832  register_type += " + BAType::Initial";
2833  } else if (ba_type == BATYPE_STEP) {
2834  register_type += " + BAType::Step";
2835  } else {
2836  throw std::runtime_error("Unhandled Before/After type encountered during code generation");
2837  }
2838  return register_type;
2839 }
2840 
2841 
2842 /**
2843  * \details Every mod file has register function to connect with the simulator.
2844  * Various information about mechanism and callbacks get registered with
2845  * the simulator using suffix_reg() function.
2846  *
2847  * Here are details:
2848  * - We should exclude that callback based on the solver, watch statements.
2849  * - If nrn_get_mechtype is < -1 means that mechanism is not used in the
2850  * context of neuron execution and hence could be ignored in coreneuron
2851  * execution.
2852  * - Ions are internally defined and their types can be queried similar to
2853  * other mechanisms.
2854  * - hoc_register_var may not be needed in the context of coreneuron
2855  * - We assume net receive buffer is on. This is because generated code is
2856  * compatible for cpu as well as gpu target.
2857  */
2858 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(readability-function-cognitive-complexity)
2859 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_mechanism_register() {
2860  printer->add_newline(2);
2861  printer->add_line("/** register channel with the simulator */");
2862  printer->fmt_push_block("void _{}_reg()", info.mod_file);
2863 
2864  // type related information
2865  auto suffix = add_escape_quote(info.mod_suffix);
2866  printer->add_newline();
2867  printer->fmt_line("int mech_type = nrn_get_mechtype({});", suffix);
2868  printer->fmt_line("{} = mech_type;", get_variable_name("mech_type", false));
2869  printer->push_block("if (mech_type == -1)");
2870  printer->add_line("return;");
2871  printer->pop_block();
2872 
2873  printer->add_newline();
2874  printer->add_line("_nrn_layout_reg(mech_type, 0);"); // 0 for SoA
2875 
2876  // register mechanism
2877  const auto mech_arguments = register_mechanism_arguments();
2878  const auto number_of_thread_objects = num_thread_objects();
2879  if (info.point_process) {
2880  printer->fmt_line("point_register_mech({}, {}, {}, {});",
2881  mech_arguments,
2882  info.constructor_node ? method_name(naming::NRN_CONSTRUCTOR_METHOD)
2883  : "nullptr",
2884  info.destructor_node ? method_name(naming::NRN_DESTRUCTOR_METHOD)
2885  : "nullptr",
2886  number_of_thread_objects);
2887  } else {
2888  printer->fmt_line("register_mech({}, {});", mech_arguments, number_of_thread_objects);
2889  if (info.constructor_node) {
2890  printer->fmt_line("register_constructor({});",
2891  method_name(naming::NRN_CONSTRUCTOR_METHOD));
2892  }
2893  }
2894 
2895  // types for ion
2896  for (const auto& ion: info.ions) {
2897  printer->fmt_line("{} = nrn_get_mechtype({});",
2898  get_variable_name(ion.name + "_type", false),
2899  add_escape_quote(ion.name + "_ion"));
2900  }
2901  printer->add_newline();
2902 
2903  /*
2904  * Register callbacks for thread allocation and cleanup. Note that thread_data_index
2905  * represent total number of thread used minus 1 (i.e. index of last thread).
2906  */
2907  if (info.vectorize && (info.thread_data_index != 0)) {
2908  // false to avoid getting the copy from the instance structure
2909  printer->fmt_line("thread_mem_init({});", get_variable_name("ext_call_thread", false));
2910  }
2911 
2912  if (!info.thread_variables.empty()) {
2913  printer->fmt_line("{} = 0;", get_variable_name("thread_data_in_use"));
2914  }
2915 
2916  if (info.thread_callback_register) {
2917  printer->add_line("_nrn_thread_reg0(mech_type, thread_mem_cleanup);");
2918  printer->add_line("_nrn_thread_reg1(mech_type, thread_mem_init);");
2919  }
2920 
2921  if (info.emit_table_thread()) {
2922  auto name = method_name("check_table_thread");
2923  printer->fmt_line("_nrn_thread_table_reg(mech_type, {});", name);
2924  }
2925 
2926  // register read/write callbacks for pointers
2927  if (info.bbcore_pointer_used) {
2928  printer->add_line("hoc_reg_bbcore_read(mech_type, bbcore_read);");
2929  printer->add_line("hoc_reg_bbcore_write(mech_type, bbcore_write);");
2930  }
2931 
2932  // register size of double and int elements
2933  // clang-format off
2934  printer->add_line("hoc_register_prop_size(mech_type, float_variables_size(), int_variables_size());");
2935  // clang-format on
2936 
2937  // register semantics for index variables
2938  for (auto& semantic: info.semantics) {
2939  auto args =
2940  fmt::format("mech_type, {}, {}", semantic.index, add_escape_quote(semantic.name));
2941  printer->fmt_line("hoc_register_dparam_semantics({});", args);
2942  }
2943 
2944  if (info.is_watch_used()) {
2945  auto watch_fun = compute_method_name(BlockType::Watch);
2946  printer->fmt_line("hoc_register_watch_check({}, mech_type);", watch_fun);
2947  }
2948 
2949  if (info.write_concentration) {
2950  printer->add_line("nrn_writes_conc(mech_type, 0);");
2951  }
2952 
2953  // register various information for point process type
2954  if (info.net_event_used) {
2955  printer->add_line("add_nrn_has_net_event(mech_type);");
2956  }
2957  if (info.artificial_cell) {
2958  printer->fmt_line("add_nrn_artcell(mech_type, {});", info.tqitem_index);
2959  }
2960  if (net_receive_buffering_required()) {
2961  printer->fmt_line("hoc_register_net_receive_buffering({}, mech_type);",
2962  method_name("net_buf_receive"));
2963  }
2964  if (info.num_net_receive_parameters != 0) {
2965  auto net_recv_init_arg = "nullptr";
2966  if (info.net_receive_initial_node != nullptr) {
2967  net_recv_init_arg = "net_init";
2968  }
2969  printer->fmt_line("set_pnt_receive(mech_type, {}, {}, num_net_receive_args());",
2970  method_name("net_receive"),
2971  net_recv_init_arg);
2972  }
2973  if (info.for_netcon_used) {
2974  // index where information about FOR_NETCON is stored in the integer array
2975  const auto index =
2976  std::find_if(info.semantics.begin(), info.semantics.end(), [](const IndexSemantics& a) {
2977  return a.name == naming::FOR_NETCON_SEMANTIC;
2978  })->index;
2979  printer->fmt_line("add_nrn_fornetcons(mech_type, {});", index);
2980  }
2981 
2982  if (info.net_event_used || info.net_send_used) {
2983  printer->add_line("hoc_register_net_send_buffering(mech_type);");
2984  }
2985 
2986  /// register all before/after blocks
2987  for (size_t i = 0; i < info.before_after_blocks.size(); i++) {
2988  // register type and associated function name for the block
2989  const auto& block = info.before_after_blocks[i];
2990  std::string register_type = get_register_type_for_ba_block(block);
2991  std::string function_name = method_name(fmt::format("nrn_before_after_{}", i));
2992  printer->fmt_line("hoc_reg_ba(mech_type, {}, {});", function_name, register_type);
2993  }
2994 
2995  // register variables for hoc
2996  printer->add_line("hoc_register_var(hoc_scalar_double, hoc_vector_double, NULL);");
2997  printer->pop_block();
2998 }
2999 
3000 
3001 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_thread_memory_callbacks() {
3002  if (!info.thread_callback_register) {
3003  return;
3004  }
3005 
3006  // thread_mem_init callback
3007  printer->add_newline(2);
3008  printer->add_line("/** thread memory allocation callback */");
3009  printer->push_block("static void thread_mem_init(ThreadDatum* thread) ");
3010 
3011  if (info.vectorize && info.derivimplicit_used()) {
3012  printer->fmt_line("thread[dith{}()].pval = nullptr;", info.derivimplicit_list_num);
3013  }
3014  if (info.vectorize && (info.top_local_thread_size != 0)) {
3015  auto length = info.top_local_thread_size;
3016  auto allocation = fmt::format("(double*)mem_alloc({}, sizeof(double))", length);
3017  printer->fmt_line("thread[top_local_var_tid()].pval = {};", allocation);
3018  }
3019  if (info.thread_var_data_size != 0) {
3020  auto length = info.thread_var_data_size;
3021  auto thread_data = get_variable_name("thread_data");
3022  auto thread_data_in_use = get_variable_name("thread_data_in_use");
3023  auto allocation = fmt::format("(double*)mem_alloc({}, sizeof(double))", length);
3024  printer->fmt_push_block("if ({})", thread_data_in_use);
3025  printer->fmt_line("thread[thread_var_tid()].pval = {};", allocation);
3026  printer->chain_block("else");
3027  printer->fmt_line("thread[thread_var_tid()].pval = {};", thread_data);
3028  printer->fmt_line("{} = 1;", thread_data_in_use);
3029  printer->pop_block();
3030  }
3031  printer->pop_block();
3032  printer->add_newline(2);
3033 
3034 
3035  // thread_mem_cleanup callback
3036  printer->add_line("/** thread memory cleanup callback */");
3037  printer->push_block("static void thread_mem_cleanup(ThreadDatum* thread) ");
3038 
3039  // clang-format off
3040  if (info.vectorize && info.derivimplicit_used()) {
3041  int n = info.derivimplicit_list_num;
3042  printer->fmt_line("free(thread[dith{}()].pval);", n);
3043  printer->fmt_line("nrn_destroy_newtonspace(static_cast<NewtonSpace*>(*newtonspace{}(thread)));", n);
3044  }
3045  // clang-format on
3046 
3047  if (info.top_local_thread_size != 0) {
3048  auto line = "free(thread[top_local_var_tid()].pval);";
3049  printer->add_line(line);
3050  }
3051  if (info.thread_var_data_size != 0) {
3052  auto thread_data = get_variable_name("thread_data");
3053  auto thread_data_in_use = get_variable_name("thread_data_in_use");
3054  printer->fmt_push_block("if (thread[thread_var_tid()].pval == {})", thread_data);
3055  printer->fmt_line("{} = 0;", thread_data_in_use);
3056  printer->chain_block("else");
3057  printer->add_line("free(thread[thread_var_tid()].pval);");
3058  printer->pop_block();
3059  }
3060  printer->pop_block();
3061 }

3063 
3064 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_mechanism_range_var_structure(bool print_initializers) {
3065  auto const value_initialize = print_initializers ? "{}" : "";
3066  auto int_type = default_int_data_type();
3067  printer->add_newline(2);
3068  printer->add_line("/** all mechanism instance variables and global variables */");
3069  printer->fmt_push_block("struct {} ", instance_struct());
3070 
3071  for (auto const& [var, type]: info.neuron_global_variables) {
3072  auto const name = var->get_name();
3073  printer->fmt_line("{}* {}{};",
3074  type,
3075  name,
3076  print_initializers ? fmt::format("{{&coreneuron::{}}}", name)
3077  : std::string{});
3078  }
3079  for (auto& var: codegen_float_variables) {
3080  const auto& name = var->get_name();
3081  auto type = get_range_var_float_type(var);
3082  auto qualifier = is_constant_variable(name) ? "const " : "";
3083  printer->fmt_line("{}{}* {}{};", qualifier, type, name, value_initialize);
3084  }
3085  for (auto& var: codegen_int_variables) {
3086  const auto& name = var.symbol->get_name();
3087  if (var.is_index || var.is_integer) {
3088  auto qualifier = var.is_constant ? "const " : "";
3089  printer->fmt_line("{}{}* {}{};", qualifier, int_type, name, value_initialize);
3090  } else {
3091  auto qualifier = var.is_constant ? "const " : "";
3092  auto type = var.is_vdata ? "void*" : default_float_data_type();
3093  printer->fmt_line("{}{}* {}{};", qualifier, type, name, value_initialize);
3094  }
3095  }
3096 
3097  printer->fmt_line("{}* {}{};",
3098  global_struct(),
3099  naming::INST_GLOBAL_MEMBER,
3100  print_initializers ? fmt::format("{{&{}}}", global_struct_instance())
3101  : std::string{});
3102  printer->pop_block(";");
3103 }

3106 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_ion_var_structure() {
3107  if (!ion_variable_struct_required()) {
3108  return;
3109  }
3110  printer->add_newline(2);
3111  printer->add_line("/** ion write variables */");
3112  printer->push_block("struct IonCurVar");
3113 
3114  std::string float_type = default_float_data_type();
3115  std::vector<std::string> members;
3116 
3117  for (auto& ion: info.ions) {
3118  for (auto& var: ion.writes) {
3119  printer->fmt_line("{} {};", float_type, var);
3120  members.push_back(var);
3121  }
3122  }
3123  for (auto& var: info.currents) {
3124  if (!info.is_ion_variable(var)) {
3125  printer->fmt_line("{} {};", float_type, var);
3126  members.push_back(var);
3127  }
3128  }
3129 
3130  print_ion_var_constructor(members);
3131 
3132  printer->pop_block(";");
3133 }

3136 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_ion_var_constructor(const std::vector<std::string>& members) {

3141  for (int i = 0; i < members.size(); i++) {
3142  printer->fmt_text("{}(0)", members[i]);
3143  if (i + 1 < members.size()) {
3144  printer->add_text(", ");
3145  }
3146  }
3147  printer->add_text(" {}");
3148  printer->add_newline();

3162 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_setup_range_variable() {
3163  auto type = float_data_type();
3164  printer->add_newline(2);
3165  printer->add_line("/** allocate and setup array for range variable */");
3166  printer->fmt_push_block("static inline {}* setup_range_variable(double* variable, int n)",
3167  type);
3168  printer->fmt_line("{0}* data = ({0}*) mem_alloc(n, sizeof({0}));", type);
3169  printer->push_block("for(size_t i = 0; i < n; i++)");
3170  printer->add_line("data[i] = variable[i];");
3171  printer->pop_block();
3172  printer->add_line("return data;");
3173  printer->pop_block();
3174 }

3176 
3177 /**
3178  * \details If floating point type like "float" is specified on command line then
3179  * we can't turn all variables to new type. This is because certain variables
3180  * are pointers to internal variables (e.g. ions). Hence, we check if given
3181  * variable can be safely converted to new type. If so, return new type.
3182  */
3183 std::string CodegenCppVisitor::get_range_var_float_type(const SymbolType& symbol) {
3184  // clang-format off
3185  auto with = NmodlType::read_ion_var
3186  | NmodlType::write_ion_var
3187  | NmodlType::pointer_var
3188  | NmodlType::bbcore_pointer_var
3189  | NmodlType::extern_neuron_variable;
3190  // clang-format on
3191  bool need_default_type = symbol->has_any_property(with);
3192  if (need_default_type) {
3193  return default_float_data_type();
3194  }
3195  return float_data_type();
3196 }

3199 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_instance_variable_setup() {
3200  if (range_variable_setup_required()) {
3201  print_setup_range_variable();
3202  }
3203 
3204  printer->add_newline();
3205  printer->add_line("// Allocate instance structure");
3206  printer->fmt_push_block("static void {}(NrnThread* nt, Memb_list* ml, int type)",
3207  method_name(naming::NRN_PRIVATE_CONSTRUCTOR_METHOD));
3208  printer->add_line("assert(!ml->instance);");
3209  printer->add_line("assert(!ml->global_variables);");
3210  printer->add_line("assert(ml->global_variables_size == 0);");
3211  printer->fmt_line("auto* const inst = new {}{{}};", instance_struct());
3212  printer->fmt_line("assert(inst->{} == &{});",
3213  naming::INST_GLOBAL_MEMBER,
3214  global_struct_instance());
3215  printer->add_line("ml->instance = inst;");
3216  printer->fmt_line("ml->global_variables = inst->{};", naming::INST_GLOBAL_MEMBER);
3217  printer->fmt_line("ml->global_variables_size = sizeof({});", global_struct());
3218  printer->pop_block();
3219  printer->add_newline();
3220 
3221  auto const cast_inst_and_assert_validity = [&]() {
3222  printer->fmt_line("auto* const inst = static_cast<{}*>(ml->instance);", instance_struct());
3223  printer->add_line("assert(inst);");
3224  printer->fmt_line("assert(inst->{});", naming::INST_GLOBAL_MEMBER);
3225  printer->fmt_line("assert(inst->{} == &{});",
3226  naming::INST_GLOBAL_MEMBER,
3227  global_struct_instance());
3228  printer->fmt_line("assert(inst->{} == ml->global_variables);", naming::INST_GLOBAL_MEMBER);
3229  printer->fmt_line("assert(ml->global_variables_size == sizeof({}));", global_struct());
3230  };
3231 
3232  // Must come before print_instance_struct_copy_to_device and
3233  // print_instance_struct_delete_from_device
3234  print_instance_struct_transfer_routine_declarations();
3235 
3236  printer->add_line("// Deallocate the instance structure");
3237  printer->fmt_push_block("static void {}(NrnThread* nt, Memb_list* ml, int type)",
3238  method_name(naming::NRN_PRIVATE_DESTRUCTOR_METHOD));
3239  cast_inst_and_assert_validity();
3240  print_instance_struct_delete_from_device();
3241  printer->add_multi_line(R"CODE(
3242  delete inst;
3243  ml->instance = nullptr;
3244  ml->global_variables = nullptr;
3245  ml->global_variables_size = 0;
3246  )CODE");
3247  printer->pop_block();
3248  printer->add_newline();
3249 
3250 
3251  printer->add_line("/** initialize mechanism instance variables */");
3252  printer->push_block("static inline void setup_instance(NrnThread* nt, Memb_list* ml)");
3253  cast_inst_and_assert_validity();
3254 
3255  std::string stride;
3256  printer->add_line("int pnodecount = ml->_nodecount_padded;");
3257  stride = "*pnodecount";
3258 
3259  printer->add_line("Datum* indexes = ml->pdata;");
3260 
3261  auto const float_type = default_float_data_type();
3262 
3263  int id = 0;
3264  std::vector<std::string> ptr_members{naming::INST_GLOBAL_MEMBER};
3265  for (auto const& [var, type]: info.neuron_global_variables) {
3266  ptr_members.push_back(var->get_name());
3267  }
3268  ptr_members.reserve(ptr_members.size() + codegen_float_variables.size() +
3269  codegen_int_variables.size());
3270  for (auto& var: codegen_float_variables) {
3271  auto name = var->get_name();
3272  auto range_var_type = get_range_var_float_type(var);
3273  if (float_type == range_var_type) {
3274  auto const variable = fmt::format("ml->data+{}{}", id, stride);
3275  printer->fmt_line("inst->{} = {};", name, variable);
3276  } else {
3277  // TODO what MOD file exercises this?
3278  printer->fmt_line("inst->{} = setup_range_variable(ml->data+{}{}, pnodecount);",
3279  name,
3280  id,
3281  stride);
3282  }
3283  ptr_members.push_back(std::move(name));
3284  id += var->get_length();
3285  }
3286 
3287  for (auto& var: codegen_int_variables) {
3288  auto name = var.symbol->get_name();
3289  auto const variable = [&var]() {
3290  if (var.is_index || var.is_integer) {
3291  return "ml->pdata";
3292  } else if (var.is_vdata) {
3293  return "nt->_vdata";
3294  } else {
3295  return "nt->_data";
3296  }
3297  }();
3298  printer->fmt_line("inst->{} = {};", name, variable);
3299  ptr_members.push_back(std::move(name));
3300  }
3301  print_instance_struct_copy_to_device();
3302  printer->pop_block(); // setup_instance
3303  printer->add_newline();
3304 
3305  print_instance_struct_transfer_routines(ptr_members);
3306 }

3309 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_initial_block(const InitialBlock* node) {
3310  if (info.artificial_cell) {
3311  printer->add_line("double v = 0.0;");
3312  } else {
3313  printer->add_line("int node_id = node_index[id];");
3314  printer->add_line("double v = voltage[node_id];");
3315  print_v_unused();
3316  }
3317 
3318  if (ion_variable_struct_required()) {
3319  printer->add_line("IonCurVar ionvar;");
3320  }
3321 
3322  // read ion statements
3323  auto read_statements = ion_read_statements(BlockType::Initial);
3324  for (auto& statement: read_statements) {
3325  printer->add_line(statement);
3326  }
3327 
3328  // initialize state variables (excluding ion state)
3329  for (auto& var: info.state_vars) {
3330  auto name = var->get_name();
3331  if (!info.is_ionic_conc(name)) {
3332  auto lhs = get_variable_name(name);
3333  auto rhs = get_variable_name(name + "0");
3334  printer->fmt_line("{} = {};", lhs, rhs);
3335  }
3336  }
3337 
3338  // initial block
3339  if (node != nullptr) {
3340  const auto& block = node->get_statement_block();
3341  print_statement_block(*block, false, false);
3342  }
3343 
3344  // write ion statements
3345  auto write_statements = ion_write_statements(BlockType::Initial);
3346  for (auto& statement: write_statements) {
3347  auto text = process_shadow_update_statement(statement, BlockType::Initial);
3348  printer->add_line(text);
3349  }
3350 }

3352 
3353 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_global_function_common_code(BlockType type,
3354  const std::string& function_name) {
3355  std::string method;
3356  if (function_name.empty()) {
3357  method = compute_method_name(type);
3358  } else {
3359  method = function_name;
3360  }
3361  auto args = "NrnThread* nt, Memb_list* ml, int type";
3362 
3363  // watch statement function doesn't have type argument
3364  if (type == BlockType::Watch) {
3365  args = "NrnThread* nt, Memb_list* ml";
3366  }
3367 
3368  print_global_method_annotation();
3369  printer->fmt_push_block("void {}({})", method, args);
3370  if (type != BlockType::Destructor && type != BlockType::Constructor) {
3371  // We do not (currently) support DESTRUCTOR and CONSTRUCTOR blocks
3372  // running anything on the GPU.
3373  print_kernel_data_present_annotation_block_begin();
3374  } else {
3375  /// TODO: Remove this when the code generation is propery done
3376  /// Related to https://github.com/BlueBrain/nmodl/issues/692
3377  printer->add_line("#ifndef CORENEURON_BUILD");
3378  }
3379  printer->add_multi_line(R"CODE(
3380  int nodecount = ml->nodecount;
3381  int pnodecount = ml->_nodecount_padded;
3382  const int* node_index = ml->nodeindices;
3383  double* data = ml->data;
3384  const double* voltage = nt->_actual_v;
3385  )CODE");
3386 
3387  if (type == BlockType::Equation) {
3388  printer->add_line("double* vec_rhs = nt->_actual_rhs;");
3389  printer->add_line("double* vec_d = nt->_actual_d;");
3390  print_rhs_d_shadow_variables();
3391  }
3392  printer->add_line("Datum* indexes = ml->pdata;");
3393  printer->add_line("ThreadDatum* thread = ml->_thread;");
3394 
3395  if (type == BlockType::Initial) {
3396  printer->add_newline();
3397  printer->add_line("setup_instance(nt, ml);");
3398  }
3399  printer->fmt_line("auto* const inst = static_cast<{}*>(ml->instance);", instance_struct());
3400  printer->add_newline(1);
3401 }

3403 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_nrn_init(bool skip_init_check) {
3404  codegen = true;
3405  printer->add_newline(2);
3406  printer->add_line("/** initialize channel */");
3407 
3408  print_global_function_common_code(BlockType::Initial);
3409  if (info.derivimplicit_used()) {
3410  printer->add_newline();
3411  int nequation = info.num_equations;
3412  int list_num = info.derivimplicit_list_num;
3413  // clang-format off
3414  printer->fmt_line("int& deriv_advance_flag = *deriv{}_advance(thread);", list_num);
3415  printer->add_line("deriv_advance_flag = 0;");
3416  print_deriv_advance_flag_transfer_to_device();
3417  printer->fmt_line("auto ns = newtonspace{}(thread);", list_num);
3418  printer->fmt_line("auto& th = thread[dith{}()];", list_num);
3419  printer->push_block("if (*ns == nullptr)");
3420  printer->fmt_line("int vec_size = 2*{}*pnodecount*sizeof(double);", nequation);
3421  printer->fmt_line("double* vec = makevector(vec_size);", nequation);
3422  printer->fmt_line("th.pval = vec;", list_num);
3423  printer->fmt_line("*ns = nrn_cons_newtonspace({}, pnodecount);", nequation);
3424  print_newtonspace_transfer_to_device();
3425  printer->pop_block();
3426  // clang-format on
3427  }
3428 
3429  // update global variable as those might be updated via python/hoc API
3430  // NOTE: CoreNEURON has enough information to do this on its own, which
3431  // would be neater.
3432  print_global_variable_device_update_annotation();
3433 
3434  if (skip_init_check) {
3435  printer->push_block("if (_nrn_skip_initmodel == 0)");
3436  }
3437 
3438  if (!info.changed_dt.empty()) {
3439  printer->fmt_line("double _save_prev_dt = {};",
3440  get_variable_name(naming::NTHREAD_DT_VARIABLE));
3441  printer->fmt_line("{} = {};",
3442  get_variable_name(naming::NTHREAD_DT_VARIABLE),
3443  info.changed_dt);
3444  print_dt_update_to_device();
3445  }
3446 
3447  print_channel_iteration_block_parallel_hint(BlockType::Initial, info.initial_node);
3448  printer->push_block("for (int id = 0; id < nodecount; id++)");
3449 
3450  if (info.net_receive_node != nullptr) {
3451  printer->fmt_line("{} = -1e20;", get_variable_name("tsave"));
3452  }
3453 
3454  print_initial_block(info.initial_node);
3455  printer->pop_block();
3456 
3457  if (!info.changed_dt.empty()) {
3458  printer->fmt_line("{} = _save_prev_dt;", get_variable_name(naming::NTHREAD_DT_VARIABLE));
3459  print_dt_update_to_device();
3460  }
3461 
3462  printer->pop_block();
3463 
3464  if (info.derivimplicit_used()) {
3465  printer->add_line("deriv_advance_flag = 1;");
3466  print_deriv_advance_flag_transfer_to_device();
3467  }
3468 
3469  if (info.net_send_used && !info.artificial_cell) {
3470  print_send_event_move();
3471  }
3472 
3473  print_kernel_data_present_annotation_block_end();
3474  if (skip_init_check) {
3475  printer->pop_block();
3476  }
3477  codegen = false;
3478 }
3479 
3480 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_before_after_block(const ast::Block* node, size_t block_id) {
3481  codegen = true;
3482 
3483  std::string ba_type;
3484  std::shared_ptr<ast::BABlock> ba_block;
3485 
3486  if (node->is_before_block()) {
3487  ba_block = dynamic_cast<const ast::BeforeBlock*>(node)->get_bablock();
3488  ba_type = "BEFORE";
3489  } else {
3490  ba_block = dynamic_cast<const ast::AfterBlock*>(node)->get_bablock();
3491  ba_type = "AFTER";
3492  }
3493 
3494  std::string ba_block_type = ba_block->get_type()->eval();
3495 
3496  /// name of the before/after function
3497  std::string function_name = method_name(fmt::format("nrn_before_after_{}", block_id));
3498 
3499  /// print common function code like init/state/current
3500  printer->add_newline(2);
3501  printer->fmt_line("/** {} of block type {} # {} */", ba_type, ba_block_type, block_id);
3502  print_global_function_common_code(BlockType::BeforeAfter, function_name);
3503 
3504  print_channel_iteration_block_parallel_hint(BlockType::BeforeAfter, node);
3505  printer->push_block("for (int id = 0; id < nodecount; id++)");
3506 
3507  printer->add_line("int node_id = node_index[id];");
3508  printer->add_line("double v = voltage[node_id];");
3509  print_v_unused();
3510 
3511  // read ion statements
3512  const auto& read_statements = ion_read_statements(BlockType::Equation);
3513  for (auto& statement: read_statements) {
3514  printer->add_line(statement);
3515  }
3516 
3517  /// print main body
3518  printer->add_indent();
3519  print_statement_block(*ba_block->get_statement_block());
3520  printer->add_newline();
3521 
3522  // write ion statements
3523  const auto& write_statements = ion_write_statements(BlockType::Equation);
3524  for (auto& statement: write_statements) {
3525  auto text = process_shadow_update_statement(statement, BlockType::Equation);
3526  printer->add_line(text);
3527  }
3528 
3529  /// loop end including data annotation block
3530  printer->pop_block();
3531  printer->pop_block();
3532  print_kernel_data_present_annotation_block_end();
3533 
3534  codegen = false;
3535 }

3581  * according to grammar. Check if this is correctly handled in neuron
3582  * and coreneuron.
3583  */
3584 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_watch_activate() {
3585  if (info.watch_statements.empty()) {
3586  return;
3587  }
3588  codegen = true;
3589  printer->add_newline(2);
3590  auto inst = fmt::format("{}* inst", instance_struct());
3591 
3592  printer->fmt_push_block(
3593  "static void nrn_watch_activate({}, int id, int pnodecount, int watch_id, "
3594  "double v, bool &watch_remove)",
3595  inst);
3596 
3597  // initialize all variables only during first watch statement
3598  printer->push_block("if (watch_remove == false)");
3599  for (int i = 0; i < info.watch_count; i++) {
3600  auto name = get_variable_name(fmt::format("watch{}", i + 1));
3601  printer->fmt_line("{} = 0;", name);
3602  }
3603  printer->add_line("watch_remove = true;");
3604  printer->pop_block();
3605 
3606  /**
3607  * \todo Similar to neuron/coreneuron we are using
3608  * first watch and ignoring rest.
3609  */
3610  for (int i = 0; i < info.watch_statements.size(); i++) {
3611  auto statement = info.watch_statements[i];
3612  printer->fmt_push_block("if (watch_id == {})", i);
3613 
3614  auto varname = get_variable_name(fmt::format("watch{}", i + 1));
3615  printer->add_indent();
3616  printer->fmt_text("{} = 2 + (", varname);
3617  auto watch = statement->get_statements().front();
3618  watch->get_expression()->visit_children(*this);
3619  printer->add_text(");");
3620  printer->add_newline();
3621 
3622  printer->pop_block();
3623  }
3624  printer->pop_block();
3625  codegen = false;
3626 }

3629 /**
3630  * \todo Similar to print_watch_activate, we are using only
3631  * first watch. need to verify with neuron/coreneuron about rest.
3632  */
3633 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_watch_check() {
3634  if (info.watch_statements.empty()) {
3635  return;
3636  }
3637  codegen = true;
3638  printer->add_newline(2);
3639  printer->add_line("/** routine to check watch activation */");
3640  print_global_function_common_code(BlockType::Watch);
3641 
3642  // WATCH statements appears in NET_RECEIVE block and while printing
3643  // net_receive function we already check if it contains any MUTEX/PROTECT
3644  // constructs. As WATCH is not a top level block but list of statements,
3645  // we don't need to have ivdep pragma related check
3646  print_channel_iteration_block_parallel_hint(BlockType::Watch, nullptr);
3647 
3648  printer->push_block("for (int id = 0; id < nodecount; id++)");
3649 
3650  if (info.is_voltage_used_by_watch_statements()) {
3651  printer->add_line("int node_id = node_index[id];");
3652  printer->add_line("double v = voltage[node_id];");
3653  print_v_unused();
3654  }
3655 
3656  // flat to make sure only one WATCH statement can be triggered at a time
3657  printer->add_line("bool watch_untriggered = true;");
3658 
3659  for (int i = 0; i < info.watch_statements.size(); i++) {
3660  auto statement = info.watch_statements[i];
3661  const auto& watch = statement->get_statements().front();
3662  const auto& varname = get_variable_name(fmt::format("watch{}", i + 1));
3663 
3664  // start block 1
3665  printer->fmt_push_block("if ({}&2 && watch_untriggered)", varname);
3666 
3667  // start block 2
3668  printer->add_indent();
3669  printer->add_text("if (");
3670  watch->get_expression()->accept(*this);
3671  printer->add_text(") {");
3672  printer->add_newline();
3673  printer->increase_indent();
3674 
3675  // start block 3
3676  printer->fmt_push_block("if (({}&1) == 0)", varname);
3677 
3678  printer->add_line("watch_untriggered = false;");
3679 
3680  const auto& tqitem = get_variable_name("tqitem");
3681  const auto& point_process = get_variable_name("point_process");
3682  printer->add_indent();
3683  printer->add_text("net_send_buffering(");
3684  const auto& t = get_variable_name("t");
3685  printer->fmt_text("nt, ml->_net_send_buffer, 0, {}, -1, {}, {}+0.0, ",
3686  tqitem,
3687  point_process,
3688  t);
3689  watch->get_value()->accept(*this);
3690  printer->add_text(");");
3691  printer->add_newline();
3692  printer->pop_block();
3693 
3694  printer->add_line(varname, " = 3;");
3695  // end block 3
3696 
3697  // start block 3
3698  printer->decrease_indent();
3699  printer->push_block("} else");
3700  printer->add_line(varname, " = 2;");
3701  printer->pop_block();
3702  // end block 3
3703 
3704  printer->pop_block();
3705  // end block 1
3706  }
3707 
3708  printer->pop_block();
3709  print_send_event_move();
3710  print_kernel_data_present_annotation_block_end();
3711  printer->pop_block();
3712  codegen = false;
3713 }

3839 
3840 /**
3841  * Rename arguments to NET_RECEIVE block with corresponding pointer variable
3842  *
3843  * Arguments to NET_RECEIVE block are packed and passed via weight vector. These
3844  * variables need to be replaced with corresponding pointer variable. For example,
3845  * if mod file is like
3846  *
3847  * \code{.mod}
3848  * NET_RECEIVE (weight, R){
3849  * INITIAL {
3850  * R=1
3851  * }
3852  * }
3853  * \endcode
3854  *
3855  * then generated code for initial block should be:
3856  *
3857  * \code{.cpp}
3858  * double* R = weights + weight_index + 0;
3859  * (*R) = 1.0;
3860  * \endcode
3861  *
3862  * So, the `R` in AST needs to be renamed with `(*R)`.
3863  */
3864 static void rename_net_receive_arguments(const ast::NetReceiveBlock& net_receive_node, const ast::Node& node) {
3865  const auto& parameters = net_receive_node.get_parameters();
3866  for (auto& parameter: parameters) {
3867  const auto& name = parameter->get_node_name();
3868  auto var_used = VarUsageVisitor().variable_used(node, name);
3869  if (var_used) {
3870  RenameVisitor vr(name, "(*" + name + ")");
3871  node.get_statement_block()->visit_children(vr);
3872  }
3873  }
3874 }

3891  printer->fmt_push_block("static void net_init({})", args);

4040 
4041 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_for_netcon(const ast::ForNetcon& node) {
4042  // For_netcon should take the same arguments as net_receive and apply the operations
4043  // in the block to the weights of the netcons. Since all the weights are on the same vector,
4044  // weights, we have a mask of operations that we apply iteratively, advancing the offset
4045  // to the next netcon.
4046  const auto& args = node.get_parameters();
4047  RenameVisitor v;
4048  const auto& statement_block = node.get_statement_block();
4049  for (size_t i_arg = 0; i_arg < args.size(); ++i_arg) {
4050  // sanitize node_name since we want to substitute names like (*w) as they are
4051  auto old_name =
4052  std::regex_replace(args[i_arg]->get_node_name(), regex_special_chars, R"(\$&)");
4053  const auto& new_name = fmt::format("weights[{} + nt->_fornetcon_weight_perm[i]]", i_arg);
4054  v.set(old_name, new_name);
4055  statement_block->accept(v);
4056  }
4057 
4058  const auto index =
4059  std::find_if(info.semantics.begin(), info.semantics.end(), [](const IndexSemantics& a) {
4060  return a.name == naming::FOR_NETCON_SEMANTIC;
4061  })->index;
4062 
4063  printer->fmt_text("const size_t offset = {}*pnodecount + id;", index);
4064  printer->add_newline();
4065  printer->add_line(
4066  "const size_t for_netcon_start = nt->_fornetcon_perm_indices[indexes[offset]];");
4067  printer->add_line(
4068  "const size_t for_netcon_end = nt->_fornetcon_perm_indices[indexes[offset] + 1];");
4069 
4070  printer->add_line("for (auto i = for_netcon_start; i < for_netcon_end; ++i) {");
4071  printer->increase_indent();
4072  print_statement_block(*statement_block, false, false);
4073  printer->decrease_indent();
4074 
4075  printer->add_line("}");
4076 }
4077 
4078 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_net_receive_kernel() {
4079  if (!net_receive_required()) {
4080  return;
4081  }
4082  codegen = true;
4083  printing_net_receive = true;
4084  const auto node = info.net_receive_node;
4085 
4086  // rename net_receive arguments used in the block itself
4087  rename_net_receive_arguments(*info.net_receive_node, *node);
4088 
4089  std::string name;
4090  ParamVector params;
4091  if (!info.artificial_cell) {
4092  name = method_name("net_receive_kernel");
4093  params.emplace_back("", "double", "", "t");
4094  params.emplace_back("", "Point_process*", "", "pnt");
4095  params.emplace_back("", fmt::format("{}*", instance_struct()),
4096  "", "inst");
4097  params.emplace_back("", "NrnThread*", "", "nt");
4098  params.emplace_back("", "Memb_list*", "", "ml");
4099  params.emplace_back("", "int", "", "weight_index");
4100  params.emplace_back("", "double", "", "flag");
4101  } else {
4102  name = method_name("net_receive");
4103  params.emplace_back("", "Point_process*", "", "pnt");
4104  params.emplace_back("", "int", "", "weight_index");
4105  params.emplace_back("", "double", "", "flag");
4106  }
4107 
4108  printer->add_newline(2);
4109  printer->fmt_push_block("static inline void {}({})", name, get_parameter_str(params));
4110  print_net_receive_common_code(*node, info.artificial_cell);
4111  if (info.artificial_cell) {
4112  printer->add_line("double t = nt->_t;");
4113  }
4114 
4115  // set voltage variable if it is used in the block (e.g. for WATCH statement)
4116  auto v_used = VarUsageVisitor().variable_used(*node->get_statement_block(), "v");
4117  if (v_used) {
4118  printer->add_line("int node_id = ml->nodeindices[id];");
4119  printer->add_line("v = nt->_actual_v[node_id];");
4120  }
4121 
4122  printer->fmt_line("{} = t;", get_variable_name("tsave"));
4123 
4124  if (info.is_watch_used()) {
4125  printer->add_line("bool watch_remove = false;");
4126  }
4127 
4128  printer->add_indent();
4129  node->get_statement_block()->accept(*this);
4130  printer->add_newline();
4131  printer->pop_block();
4132 
4133  printing_net_receive = false;
4134  codegen = false;
4135 }

4137 
4138 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_net_receive() {
4139  if (!net_receive_required()) {
4140  return;
4141  }
4142  codegen = true;
4143  printing_net_receive = true;
4144  if (!info.artificial_cell) {
4145  const auto& name = method_name("net_receive");
4146  ParamVector params;
4147  params.emplace_back("", "Point_process*", "", "pnt");
4148  params.emplace_back("", "int", "", "weight_index");
4149  params.emplace_back("", "double", "", "flag");
4150  printer->add_newline(2);
4151  printer->fmt_push_block("static void {}({})", name, get_parameter_str(params));
4152  printer->add_line("NrnThread* nt = nrn_threads + pnt->_tid;");
4153  printer->add_line("Memb_list* ml = get_memb_list(nt);");
4154  printer->add_line("NetReceiveBuffer_t* nrb = ml->_net_receive_buffer;");
4155  printer->push_block("if (nrb->_cnt >= nrb->_size)");
4156  printer->add_line("realloc_net_receive_buffer(nt, ml);");
4157  printer->pop_block();
4158  printer->add_multi_line(R"CODE(
4159  int id = nrb->_cnt;
4160  nrb->_pnt_index[id] = pnt-nt->pntprocs;
4161  nrb->_weight_index[id] = weight_index;
4162  nrb->_nrb_t[id] = nt->_t;
4163  nrb->_nrb_flag[id] = flag;
4164  nrb->_cnt++;
4165  )CODE");
4166  printer->pop_block();
4167  }
4168  printing_net_receive = false;
4169  codegen = false;
4170 }

4173 /**
4174  * \todo Data is not derived. Need to add instance into instance struct?
4175  * data used here is wrong in AoS because as in original implementation,
4176  * data is not incremented every iteration for AoS. May be better to derive
4177  * actual variable names? [resolved now?]
4178  * slist needs to added as local variable
4179  */
4180 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_derivimplicit_kernel(const Block& block) {
4181  auto ext_args = external_method_arguments();
4182  auto ext_params = external_method_parameters();
4183  auto suffix = info.mod_suffix;
4184  auto list_num = info.derivimplicit_list_num;
4185  auto block_name = block.get_node_name();
4186  auto primes_size = info.primes_size;
4187  auto stride = "*pnodecount+id";
4188 
4189  printer->add_newline(2);
4190 
4191  printer->push_block("namespace");
4192  printer->fmt_push_block("struct _newton_{}_{}", block_name, info.mod_suffix);
4193  printer->fmt_push_block("int operator()({}) const", external_method_parameters());
4194  auto const instance = fmt::format("auto* const inst = static_cast<{0}*>(ml->instance);",
4195  instance_struct());
4196  auto const slist1 = fmt::format("auto const& slist{} = {};",
4197  list_num,
4198  get_variable_name(fmt::format("slist{}", list_num)));
4199  auto const slist2 = fmt::format("auto& slist{} = {};",
4200  list_num + 1,
4201  get_variable_name(fmt::format("slist{}", list_num + 1)));
4202  auto const dlist1 = fmt::format("auto const& dlist{} = {};",
4203  list_num,
4204  get_variable_name(fmt::format("dlist{}", list_num)));
4205  auto const dlist2 = fmt::format(
4206  "double* dlist{} = static_cast<double*>(thread[dith{}()].pval) + ({}*pnodecount);",
4207  list_num + 1,
4208  list_num,
4209  info.primes_size);
4210  printer->add_line(instance);
4211  if (ion_variable_struct_required()) {
4212  print_ion_variable();
4213  }
4214  printer->fmt_line("double* savstate{} = static_cast<double*>(thread[dith{}()].pval);",
4215  list_num,
4216  list_num);
4217  printer->add_line(slist1);
4218  printer->add_line(dlist1);
4219  printer->add_line(dlist2);
4220  codegen = true;
4221  print_statement_block(*block.get_statement_block(), false, false);
4222  codegen = false;
4223  printer->add_line("int counter = -1;");
4224  printer->fmt_push_block("for (int i=0; i<{}; i++)", info.num_primes);
4225  printer->fmt_push_block("if (*deriv{}_advance(thread))", list_num);
4226  printer->fmt_line(
4227  "dlist{0}[(++counter){1}] = "
4228  "data[dlist{2}[i]{1}]-(data[slist{2}[i]{1}]-savstate{2}[i{1}])/nt->_dt;",
4229  list_num + 1,
4230  stride,
4231  list_num);
4232  printer->chain_block("else");
4233  printer->fmt_line("dlist{0}[(++counter){1}] = data[slist{2}[i]{1}]-savstate{2}[i{1}];",
4234  list_num + 1,
4235  stride,
4236  list_num);
4237  printer->pop_block();
4238  printer->pop_block();
4239  printer->add_line("return 0;");
4240  printer->pop_block(); // operator()
4241  printer->pop_block(";"); // struct
4242  printer->pop_block(); // namespace
4243  printer->add_newline();
4244  printer->fmt_push_block("int {}_{}({})", block_name, suffix, ext_params);
4245  printer->add_line(instance);
4246  printer->fmt_line("double* savstate{} = (double*) thread[dith{}()].pval;", list_num, list_num);
4247  printer->add_line(slist1);
4248  printer->add_line(slist2);
4249  printer->add_line(dlist2);
4250  printer->fmt_push_block("for (int i=0; i<{}; i++)", info.num_primes);
4251  printer->fmt_line("savstate{}[i{}] = data[slist{}[i]{}];", list_num, stride, list_num, stride);
4252  printer->pop_block();
4253  printer->fmt_line(
4254  "int reset = nrn_newton_thread(static_cast<NewtonSpace*>(*newtonspace{}(thread)), {}, "
4255  "slist{}, _newton_{}_{}{{}}, dlist{}, {});",
4256  list_num,
4257  primes_size,
4258  list_num + 1,
4259  block_name,
4260  suffix,
4261  list_num + 1,
4262  ext_args);
4263  printer->add_line("return reset;");
4264  printer->pop_block();
4265  printer->add_newline(2);
4266 }

4284 void CodegenCppVisitor::visit_solution_expression(const SolutionExpression& node) {
4285  auto block = node.get_node_to_solve().get();
4286  if (block->is_statement_block()) {
4287  auto statement_block = dynamic_cast<ast::StatementBlock*>(block);
4288  print_statement_block(*statement_block, false, false);
4289  } else {
4290  block->accept(*this);

4300 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_nrn_state() {
4301  if (!nrn_state_required()) {
4302  return;
4303  }
4304  codegen = true;
4305 
4306  printer->add_newline(2);
4307  printer->add_line("/** update state */");
4308  print_global_function_common_code(BlockType::State);
4309  print_channel_iteration_block_parallel_hint(BlockType::State, info.nrn_state_block);
4310  printer->push_block("for (int id = 0; id < nodecount; id++)");
4311 
4312  printer->add_line("int node_id = node_index[id];");
4313  printer->add_line("double v = voltage[node_id];");
4314  print_v_unused();
4315 
4316  /**
4317  * \todo Eigen solver node also emits IonCurVar variable in the functor
4318  * but that shouldn't update ions in derivative block
4319  */
4320  if (ion_variable_struct_required()) {
4321  print_ion_variable();
4322  }
4323 
4324  auto read_statements = ion_read_statements(BlockType::State);
4325  for (auto& statement: read_statements) {
4326  printer->add_line(statement);
4327  }
4328 
4329  if (info.nrn_state_block) {
4330  info.nrn_state_block->visit_children(*this);
4331  }
4332 
4333  if (info.currents.empty() && info.breakpoint_node != nullptr) {
4334  auto block = info.breakpoint_node->get_statement_block();
4335  print_statement_block(*block, false, false);
4336  }
4337 
4338  const auto& write_statements = ion_write_statements(BlockType::State);
4339  for (auto& statement: write_statements) {
4340  const auto& text = process_shadow_update_statement(statement, BlockType::State);
4341  printer->add_line(text);
4342  }
4343  printer->pop_block();
4344 
4345  print_kernel_data_present_annotation_block_end();
4346 
4347  printer->pop_block();
4348  codegen = false;
4349 }

4357 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_nrn_current(const BreakpointBlock& node) {

4363  info.mod_suffix,
4364  get_parameter_str(args));

4376 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_nrn_cur_conductance_kernel(const BreakpointBlock& node) {
4377  const auto& block = node.get_statement_block();
4378  print_statement_block(*block, false, false);
4379  if (!info.currents.empty()) {
4380  std::string sum;
4381  for (const auto& current: info.currents) {
4382  auto var = breakpoint_current(current);
4383  sum += get_variable_name(var);
4384  if (&current != &info.currents.back()) {
4385  sum += "+";
4386  }
4387  }
4388  printer->fmt_line("double rhs = {};", sum);
4389  }
4390 
4391  std::string sum;
4392  for (const auto& conductance: info.conductances) {
4393  auto var = breakpoint_current(conductance.variable);
4394  sum += get_variable_name(var);
4395  if (&conductance != &info.conductances.back()) {
4396  sum += "+";
4397  }
4398  }
4399  printer->fmt_line("double g = {};", sum);
4400 
4401  for (const auto& conductance: info.conductances) {
4402  if (!conductance.ion.empty()) {
4403  const auto& lhs = std::string(naming::ION_VARNAME_PREFIX) + "di" + conductance.ion + "dv";
4404  const auto& rhs = get_variable_name(conductance.variable);
4405  const ShadowUseStatement statement{lhs, "+=", rhs};
4406  const auto& text = process_shadow_update_statement(statement, BlockType::Equation);
4407  printer->add_line(text);
4408  }
4409  }
4410 }

4413 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_nrn_cur_non_conductance_kernel() {
4414  printer->fmt_line("double g = nrn_current_{}({}+0.001);",
4415  info.mod_suffix,
4416  internal_method_arguments());
4417  for (auto& ion: info.ions) {
4418  for (auto& var: ion.writes) {
4419  if (ion.is_ionic_current(var)) {
4420  const auto& name = get_variable_name(var);
4421  printer->fmt_line("double di{} = {};", ion.name, name);
4422  }
4423  }
4424  }
4425  printer->fmt_line("double rhs = nrn_current_{}({});",
4426  info.mod_suffix,
4427  internal_method_arguments());
4428  printer->add_line("g = (g-rhs)/0.001;");
4429  for (auto& ion: info.ions) {
4430  for (auto& var: ion.writes) {
4431  if (ion.is_ionic_current(var)) {
4432  const auto& lhs = std::string(naming::ION_VARNAME_PREFIX) + "di" + ion.name + "dv";
4433  auto rhs = fmt::format("(di{}-{})/0.001", ion.name, get_variable_name(var));
4434  if (info.point_process) {
4435  auto area = get_variable_name(naming::NODE_AREA_VARIABLE);
4436  rhs += fmt::format("*1.e2/{}", area);
4437  }
4438  const ShadowUseStatement statement{lhs, "+=", rhs};
4439  const auto& text = process_shadow_update_statement(statement, BlockType::Equation);
4440  printer->add_line(text);
4441  }
4442  }
4443  }
4444 }

4447 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_nrn_cur_kernel(const BreakpointBlock& node) {
4448  printer->add_line("int node_id = node_index[id];");
4449  printer->add_line("double v = voltage[node_id];");
4450  print_v_unused();
4451  if (ion_variable_struct_required()) {
4452  print_ion_variable();
4453  }
4454 
4455  const auto& read_statements = ion_read_statements(BlockType::Equation);
4456  for (auto& statement: read_statements) {
4457  printer->add_line(statement);
4458  }
4459 
4460  if (info.conductances.empty()) {
4461  print_nrn_cur_non_conductance_kernel();
4462  } else {
4463  print_nrn_cur_conductance_kernel(node);
4464  }
4465 
4466  const auto& write_statements = ion_write_statements(BlockType::Equation);
4467  for (auto& statement: write_statements) {
4468  auto text = process_shadow_update_statement(statement, BlockType::Equation);
4469  printer->add_line(text);
4470  }
4471 
4472  if (info.point_process) {
4473  const auto& area = get_variable_name(naming::NODE_AREA_VARIABLE);
4474  printer->fmt_line("double mfactor = 1.e2/{};", area);
4475  printer->add_line("g = g*mfactor;");
4476  printer->add_line("rhs = rhs*mfactor;");
4477  }
4478 
4479  print_g_unused();
4480 }

4482 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_fast_imem_calculation() {
4483  if (!info.electrode_current) {
4484  return;
4485  }
4486  std::string rhs, d;
4487  auto rhs_op = operator_for_rhs();
4488  auto d_op = operator_for_d();
4489  if (info.point_process) {
4490  rhs = "shadow_rhs[id]";
4491  d = "shadow_d[id]";
4492  } else {
4493  rhs = "rhs";
4494  d = "g";
4495  }
4496 
4497  printer->push_block("if (nt->nrn_fast_imem)");
4498  if (nrn_cur_reduction_loop_required()) {
4499  printer->push_block("for (int id = 0; id < nodecount; id++)");
4500  printer->add_line("int node_id = node_index[id];");
4501  }
4502  printer->fmt_line("nt->nrn_fast_imem->nrn_sav_rhs[node_id] {} {};", rhs_op, rhs);
4503  printer->fmt_line("nt->nrn_fast_imem->nrn_sav_d[node_id] {} {};", d_op, d);
4504  if (nrn_cur_reduction_loop_required()) {
4505  printer->pop_block();
4506  }
4507  printer->pop_block();
4508 }

4510 void CodegenCppVisitor::print_nrn_cur() {
4511  if (!nrn_cur_required()) {
4512  return;
4513  }
4514 
4515  codegen = true;
4516  if (info.conductances.empty()) {
4517  print_nrn_current(*info.breakpoint_node);
4518  }
4519 
4520  printer->add_newline(2);
4521  printer->add_line("/** update current */");
4522  print_global_function_common_code(BlockType::Equation);
4523  print_channel_iteration_block_parallel_hint(BlockType::Equation, info.breakpoint_node);
4524  printer->push_block("for (int id = 0; id < nodecount; id++)");
4525  print_nrn_cur_kernel(*info.breakpoint_node);
4526  print_nrn_cur_matrix_shadow_update();
4527  if (!nrn_cur_reduction_loop_required()) {
4528  print_fast_imem_calculation();
4529  }
4530  printer->pop_block();
4531 
4532  if (nrn_cur_reduction_loop_required()) {
4533  printer->push_block("for (int id = 0; id < nodecount; id++)");
4534  print_nrn_cur_matrix_shadow_reduction();
4535  printer->pop_block();
4536  print_fast_imem_calculation();
4537  }
4538 
4539  print_kernel_data_present_annotation_block_end();
4540  printer->pop_block();
4541  codegen = false;
4542 }
